text: These are the words which Moses spoke to all Israel beyond the Jordan in the wilderness, in the Arabah opposite Suf, between Paran, Tophel, Laban, Hazeroth, and Dizahab.
speaker: Narrator

text: It is eleven days’ journey from Horeb by the way of Mount Seir to Kadesh Barnea.
speaker: Narrator

text: In the fortieth year, in the eleventh month, on the first day of the month, Moses spoke to the children of Israel according to all that Yahweh had given him in commandment to them,
speaker: Narrator

text: after he had struck Sihon the king of the Amorites who lived in Heshbon, and Og the king of Bashan who lived in Ashtaroth, at Edrei.
speaker: Narrator

text: Beyond the Jordan, in the land of Moab, Moses began to declare this law, saying,
speaker: Narrator

text: “Yahweh our God spoke to us in Horeb, saying, ‘You have lived long enough at this mountain.
speaker: Narrator

text: Turn, and take your journey, and go to the hill country of the Amorites and to all the places near there: in the Arabah, in the hill country, in the lowland, in the South, by the seashore, in the land of the Canaanites, and in Lebanon as far as the great river, the river Euphrates.
speaker: Narrator

text: Behold, I have set the land before you. Go in and possess the land which Yahweh swore to your fathers—to Abraham, to Isaac, and to Jacob—to give to them and to their offspring after them.’”
speaker: Narrator

text: I spoke to you at that time, saying, “I am not able to bear you myself alone.
speaker: Narrator

text: Yahweh your God has multiplied you, and behold, you are today as the stars of the sky for multitude.
speaker: Narrator

text: May Yahweh, the God of your fathers, make you a thousand times as many as you are and bless you, as he has promised you!
speaker: Narrator

text: How can I myself alone bear your problems, your burdens, and your strife?
speaker: Narrator

text: Take wise men of understanding who are respected among your tribes, and I will make them heads over you.”
speaker: Narrator

text: You answered me, and said, “The thing which you have spoken is good to do.”
speaker: Narrator

text: So I took the heads of your tribes, wise and respected men, and made them heads over you, captains of thousands, captains of hundreds, captains of fifties, captains of tens, and officers, according to your tribes.
speaker: Narrator

text: I commanded your judges at that time, saying, “Hear cases between your brothers and judge righteously between a man and his brother, and the foreigner who is living with him.
speaker: Narrator

text: You shall not show partiality in judgment; you shall hear the small and the great alike. You shall not be afraid of the face of man, for the judgment is God’s. The case that is too hard for you, you shall bring to me, and I will hear it.”
speaker: Narrator

text: I commanded you at that time all the things which you should do.
speaker: Narrator

text: We traveled from Horeb and went through all that great and terrible wilderness which you saw, by the way to the hill country of the Amorites, as Yahweh our God commanded us; and we came to Kadesh Barnea.
speaker: Narrator

text: I said to you, “You have come to the hill country of the Amorites, which Yahweh our God gives to us.
speaker: Narrator

text: Behold, Yahweh your God has set the land before you. Go up, take possession, as Yahweh the God of your fathers has spoken to you. Don’t be afraid, neither be dismayed.”
speaker: Narrator

text: You came near to me, everyone of you, and said, “Let’s send men before us, that they may search the land for us, and bring back to us word of the way by which we must go up, and the cities to which we shall come.”
speaker: Narrator

text: The thing pleased me well. I took twelve of your men, one man for every tribe.
speaker: Narrator

text: They turned and went up into the hill country, and came to the valley of Eshcol, and spied it out.
speaker: Narrator

text: They took some of the fruit of the land in their hands and brought it down to us, and brought us word again, and said, “It is a good land which Yahweh our God gives to us.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Yet you wouldn’t go up, but rebelled against the commandment of Yahweh your God.
speaker: Narrator

text: You murmured in your tents, and said, “Because Yahweh hated us, he has brought us out of the land of Egypt, to deliver us into the hand of the Amorites to destroy us.
speaker: Narrator

text: Where are we going up? Our brothers have made our heart melt, saying, ‘The people are greater and taller than we. The cities are great and fortified up to the sky. Moreover we have seen the sons of the Anakim there!’”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then I said to you, “Don’t be terrified. Don’t be afraid of them.
speaker: Narrator

text: Yahweh your God, who goes before you, he will fight for you, according to all that he did for you in Egypt before your eyes,
speaker: Narrator

text: and in the wilderness where you have seen how that Yahweh your God carried you, as a man carries his son, in all the way that you went, until you came to this place.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Yet in this thing you didn’t believe Yahweh your God,
speaker: Narrator

text: who went before you on the way, to seek out a place for you to pitch your tents in: in fire by night, to show you by what way you should go, and in the cloud by day.
speaker: Narrator

text: Yahweh heard the voice of your words and was angry, and swore, saying,
speaker: Narrator

text: “Surely not one of these men of this evil generation shall see the good land which I swore to give to your fathers,
speaker: Narrator

text: except Caleb the son of Jephunneh. He shall see it. I will give the land that he has trodden on to him and to his children, because he has wholly followed Yahweh.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Also Yahweh was angry with me for your sakes, saying, “You also shall not go in there.
speaker: Narrator

text: Joshua the son of Nun, who stands before you, shall go in there. Encourage him, for he shall cause Israel to inherit it.
speaker: Narrator

text: Moreover your little ones, whom you said would be captured or killed, your children, who today have no knowledge of good or evil, shall go in there. I will give it to them, and they shall possess it.
speaker: Narrator

text: But as for you, turn, and take your journey into the wilderness by the way to the Red Sea.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then you answered and said to me, “We have sinned against Yahweh. We will go up and fight, according to all that Yahweh our God commanded us.” Every man of you put on his weapons of war, and presumed to go up into the hill country.
speaker: Narrator

text: Yahweh said to me, “Tell them, ‘Don’t go up and don’t fight; for I am not among you, lest you be struck before your enemies.’”
speaker: Narrator

text: So I spoke to you, and you didn’t listen; but you rebelled against the commandment of Yahweh, and were presumptuous, and went up into the hill country.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Amorites, who lived in that hill country, came out against you and chased you as bees do, and beat you down in Seir, even to Hormah.
speaker: Narrator

text: You returned and wept before Yahweh, but Yahweh didn’t listen to your voice, nor turn his ear to you.
speaker: Narrator

text: So you stayed in Kadesh many days, according to the days that you remained.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then we turned, and took our journey into the wilderness by the way to the Red Sea, as Yahweh spoke to me; and we encircled Mount Seir many days.
speaker: Narrator

text: Yahweh spoke to me, saying,
speaker: Narrator

text: “You have encircled this mountain long enough. Turn northward.
speaker: Narrator

text: Command the people, saying, ‘You are to pass through the border of your brothers, the children of Esau, who dwell in Seir; and they will be afraid of you. Therefore be careful.
speaker: Narrator

text: Don’t contend with them; for I will not give you any of their land, no, not so much as for the sole of the foot to tread on, because I have given Mount Seir to Esau for a possession.
speaker: Narrator

text: You shall purchase food from them for money, that you may eat. You shall also buy water from them for money, that you may drink.’”
speaker: Narrator

text: For Yahweh your God has blessed you in all the work of your hands. He has known your walking through this great wilderness. These forty years, Yahweh your God has been with you. You have lacked nothing.
speaker: Narrator

text: So we passed by from our brothers, the children of Esau, who dwell in Seir, from the way of the Arabah from Elath and from Ezion Geber. We turned and passed by the way of the wilderness of Moab.
speaker: Narrator

text: Yahweh said to me, “Don’t bother Moab, neither contend with them in battle; for I will not give you any of his land for a possession, because I have given Ar to the children of Lot for a possession.”
speaker: Narrator

text: (The Emim lived there before, a great and numerous people, and tall as the Anakim.
speaker: Narrator

text: These also are considered to be Rephaim, as the Anakim; but the Moabites call them Emim.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Horites also lived in Seir in the past, but the children of Esau succeeded them. They destroyed them from before them, and lived in their place, as Israel did to the land of his possession, which Yahweh gave to them.)
speaker: Narrator

text: “Now rise up and cross over the brook Zered.” We went over the brook Zered.
speaker: Narrator

text: The days in which we came from Kadesh Barnea until we had come over the brook Zered were thirty-eight years, until all the generation of the men of war were consumed from the middle of the camp, as Yahweh swore to them.
speaker: Narrator

text: Moreover Yahweh’s hand was against them, to destroy them from the middle of the camp, until they were consumed.
speaker: Narrator

text: So, when all the men of war were consumed and dead from among the people,
speaker: Narrator

text: Yahweh spoke to me, saying,
speaker: Narrator

text: “You are to pass over Ar, the border of Moab, today.
speaker: Narrator

text: When you come near the border of the children of Ammon, don’t bother them, nor contend with them; for I will not give you any of the land of the children of Ammon for a possession, because I have given it to the children of Lot for a possession.”
speaker: Narrator

text: (That also is considered a land of Rephaim. Rephaim lived there in the past, but the Ammonites call them Zamzummim,
speaker: Narrator

text: a great people, many, and tall, as the Anakim; but Yahweh destroyed them from before Israel, and they succeeded them, and lived in their place,
speaker: Narrator

text: as he did for the children of Esau who dwell in Seir, when he destroyed the Horites from before them; and they succeeded them, and lived in their place even to this day.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the Avvim, who lived in villages as far as Gaza: the Caphtorim, who came out of Caphtor, destroyed them and lived in their place.)
speaker: Narrator

text: “Rise up, take your journey, and pass over the valley of the Arnon. Behold, I have given into your hand Sihon the Amorite, king of Heshbon, and his land; begin to possess it, and contend with him in battle.
speaker: Narrator

text: Today I will begin to put the dread of you and the fear of you on the peoples who are under the whole sky, who shall hear the report of you, and shall tremble and be in anguish because of you.”
speaker: Narrator

text: I sent messengers out of the wilderness of Kedemoth to Sihon king of Heshbon with words of peace, saying,
speaker: Narrator

text: “Let me pass through your land. I will go along by the highway. I will turn neither to the right hand nor to the left.
speaker: Narrator

text: You shall sell me food for money, that I may eat; and give me water for money, that I may drink. Just let me pass through on my feet,
speaker: Narrator

text: as the children of Esau who dwell in Seir, and the Moabites who dwell in Ar, did to me, until I pass over the Jordan into the land which Yahweh our God gives us.”
speaker: Narrator

text: But Sihon king of Heshbon would not let us pass by him, for Yahweh your God hardened his spirit and made his heart obstinate, that he might deliver him into your hand, as it is today.
speaker: Narrator

text: Yahweh said to me, “Behold, I have begun to deliver up Sihon and his land before you. Begin to possess, that you may inherit his land.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Sihon came out against us, he and all his people, to battle at Jahaz.
speaker: Narrator

text: Yahweh our God delivered him up before us; and we struck him, his sons, and all his people.
speaker: Narrator

text: We took all his cities at that time, and utterly destroyed every inhabited city, with the women and the little ones. We left no one remaining.
speaker: Narrator

text: Only the livestock we took for plunder for ourselves, with the plunder of the cities which we had taken.
speaker: Narrator

text: From Aroer, which is on the edge of the valley of the Arnon, and the city that is in the valley, even to Gilead, there was not a city too high for us. Yahweh our God delivered up all before us.
speaker: Narrator

text: Only to the land of the children of Ammon you didn’t come near: all the banks of the river Jabbok, and the cities of the hill country, and wherever Yahweh our God forbade us.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then we turned, and went up the way to Bashan. Og the king of Bashan came out against us, he and all his people, to battle at Edrei.
speaker: Narrator

text: Yahweh said to me, “Don’t fear him; for I have delivered him, with all his people and his land, into your hand. You shall do to him as you did to Sihon king of the Amorites, who lived at Heshbon.”
speaker: Narrator

text: So Yahweh our God also delivered into our hand Og, the king of Bashan, and all his people. We struck him until no one was left to him remaining.
speaker: Narrator

text: We took all his cities at that time. There was not a city which we didn’t take from them: sixty cities, all the region of Argob, the kingdom of Og in Bashan.
speaker: Narrator

text: All these were cities fortified with high walls, gates, and bars, in addition to a great many villages without walls.
speaker: Narrator

text: We utterly destroyed them, as we did to Sihon king of Heshbon, utterly destroying every inhabited city, with the women and the little ones.
speaker: Narrator

text: But all the livestock, and the plunder of the cities, we took for plunder for ourselves.
speaker: Narrator

text: We took the land at that time out of the hand of the two kings of the Amorites who were beyond the Jordan, from the valley of the Arnon to Mount Hermon.
speaker: Narrator

text: (The Sidonians call Hermon Sirion, and the Amorites call it Senir.)
speaker: Narrator

text: We took all the cities of the plain, and all Gilead, and all Bashan, to Salecah and Edrei, cities of the kingdom of Og in Bashan.
speaker: Narrator

text: (For only Og king of Bashan remained of the remnant of the Rephaim. Behold, his bedstead was a bedstead of iron. Isn’t it in Rabbah of the children of Ammon? Nine cubits was its length, and four cubits its width, after the cubit of a man.)
speaker: Narrator

text: This land we took in possession at that time: from Aroer, which is by the valley of the Arnon, and half the hill country of Gilead with its cities, I gave to the Reubenites and to the Gadites;
speaker: Narrator

text: and the rest of Gilead, and all Bashan, the kingdom of Og, I gave to the half-tribe of Manasseh—all the region of Argob, even all Bashan. (The same is called the land of Rephaim.
speaker: Narrator

text: Jair the son of Manasseh took all the region of Argob, to the border of the Geshurites and the Maacathites, and called them, even Bashan, after his own name, Havvoth Jair, to this day.)
speaker: Narrator

text: I gave Gilead to Machir.
speaker: Narrator

text: To the Reubenites and to the Gadites I gave from Gilead even to the valley of the Arnon, the middle of the valley, and its border, even to the river Jabbok, which is the border of the children of Ammon;
speaker: Narrator

text: the Arabah also, and the Jordan and its border, from Chinnereth even to the sea of the Arabah, the Salt Sea, under the slopes of Pisgah eastward.
speaker: Narrator

text: I commanded you at that time, saying, “Yahweh your God has given you this land to possess it. All of you men of valor shall pass over armed before your brothers, the children of Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: But your wives, and your little ones, and your livestock, (I know that you have much livestock), shall live in your cities which I have given you,
speaker: Narrator

text: until Yahweh gives rest to your brothers, as to you, and they also possess the land which Yahweh your God gives them beyond the Jordan. Then you shall each return to his own possession, which I have given you.”
speaker: Narrator

text: I commanded Joshua at that time, saying, “Your eyes have seen all that Yahweh your God has done to these two kings. So shall Yahweh do to all the kingdoms where you go over.
speaker: Narrator

text: You shall not fear them; for Yahweh your God himself fights for you.”
speaker: Narrator

text: I begged Yahweh at that time, saying,
speaker: Narrator

text: “Lord Yahweh, you have begun to show your servant your greatness, and your strong hand. For what god is there in heaven or in earth that can do works like yours, and mighty acts like yours?
speaker: Narrator

text: Please let me go over and see the good land that is beyond the Jordan, that fine mountain, and Lebanon.”
speaker: Narrator

text: But Yahweh was angry with me because of you, and didn’t listen to me. Yahweh said to me, “That is enough! Speak no more to me of this matter.
speaker: Narrator

text: Go up to the top of Pisgah, and lift up your eyes westward, and northward, and southward, and eastward, and see with your eyes; for you shall not go over this Jordan.
speaker: Narrator

text: But commission Joshua, and encourage him, and strengthen him; for he shall go over before this people, and he shall cause them to inherit the land which you shall see.”
speaker: Narrator

text: So we stayed in the valley near Beth Peor.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now, Israel, listen to the statutes and to the ordinances which I teach you, to do them, that you may live and go in and possess the land which Yahweh, the God of your fathers, gives you.
speaker: Narrator

text: You shall not add to the word which I command you, neither shall you take away from it, that you may keep the commandments of Yahweh your God which I command you.
speaker: Narrator

text: Your eyes have seen what Yahweh did because of Baal Peor; for Yahweh your God has destroyed all the men who followed Baal Peor from among you.
speaker: Narrator

text: But you who were faithful to Yahweh your God are all alive today.
speaker: Narrator

text: Behold, I have taught you statutes and ordinances, even as Yahweh my God commanded me, that you should do so in the middle of the land where you go in to possess it.
speaker: Narrator

text: Keep therefore and do them; for this is your wisdom and your understanding in the sight of the peoples who shall hear all these statutes and say, “Surely this great nation is a wise and understanding people.”
speaker: Narrator

text: For what great nation is there that has a god so near to them as Yahweh our God is whenever we call on him?
speaker: Narrator

text: What great nation is there that has statutes and ordinances so righteous as all this law which I set before you today?
speaker: Narrator

text: Only be careful, and keep your soul diligently, lest you forget the things which your eyes saw, and lest they depart from your heart all the days of your life; but make them known to your children and your children’s children—
speaker: Narrator

text: the day that you stood before Yahweh your God in Horeb, when Yahweh said to me, “Assemble the people to me, and I will make them hear my words, that they may learn to fear me all the days that they live on the earth, and that they may teach their children.”
speaker: Narrator

text: You came near and stood under the mountain. The mountain burned with fire to the heart of the sky, with darkness, cloud, and thick darkness.
speaker: Narrator

text: Yahweh spoke to you out of the middle of the fire: you heard the voice of words, but you saw no form; you only heard a voice.
speaker: Narrator

text: He declared to you his covenant, which he commanded you to perform, even the ten commandments. He wrote them on two stone tablets.
speaker: Narrator

text: Yahweh commanded me at that time to teach you statutes and ordinances, that you might do them in the land where you go over to possess it.
speaker: Narrator

text: Be very careful, for you saw no kind of form on the day that Yahweh spoke to you in Horeb out of the middle of the fire,
speaker: Narrator

text: lest you corrupt yourselves, and make yourself a carved image in the form of any figure, the likeness of male or female,
speaker: Narrator

text: the likeness of any animal that is on the earth, the likeness of any winged bird that flies in the sky,
speaker: Narrator

text: the likeness of anything that creeps on the ground, the likeness of any fish that is in the water under the earth;
speaker: Narrator

text: and lest you lift up your eyes to the sky, and when you see the sun and the moon and the stars, even all the army of the sky, you are drawn away and worship them, and serve them, which Yahweh your God has allotted to all the peoples under the whole sky.
speaker: Narrator

text: But Yahweh has taken you, and brought you out of the iron furnace, out of Egypt, to be to him a people of inheritance, as it is today.
speaker: Narrator

text: Furthermore Yahweh was angry with me for your sakes, and swore that I should not go over the Jordan, and that I should not go in to that good land which Yahweh your God gives you for an inheritance;
speaker: Narrator

text: but I must die in this land. I must not go over the Jordan, but you shall go over and possess that good land.
speaker: Narrator

text: Be careful, lest you forget the covenant of Yahweh your God, which he made with you, and make yourselves a carved image in the form of anything which Yahweh your God has forbidden you.
speaker: Narrator

text: For Yahweh your God is a devouring fire, a jealous God.
speaker: Narrator

text: When you father children and children’s children, and you have been long in the land, and then corrupt yourselves, and make a carved image in the form of anything, and do that which is evil in Yahweh your God’s sight to provoke him to anger,
speaker: Narrator

text: I call heaven and earth to witness against you today, that you will soon utterly perish from off the land which you go over the Jordan to possess it. You will not prolong your days on it, but will utterly be destroyed.
speaker: Narrator

text: Yahweh will scatter you among the peoples, and you will be left few in number among the nations where Yahweh will lead you away.
speaker: Narrator

text: There you will serve gods, the work of men’s hands, wood and stone, which neither see, nor hear, nor eat, nor smell.
speaker: Narrator

text: But from there you shall seek Yahweh your God, and you will find him when you search after him with all your heart and with all your soul.
speaker: Narrator

text: When you are in oppression, and all these things have come on you, in the latter days you shall return to Yahweh your God and listen to his voice.
speaker: Narrator

text: For Yahweh your God is a merciful God. He will not fail you nor destroy you, nor forget the covenant of your fathers which he swore to them.
speaker: Narrator

text: For ask now of the days that are past, which were before you, since the day that God created man on the earth, and from the one end of the sky to the other, whether there has been anything as great as this thing is, or has been heard like it?
speaker: Narrator

text: Did a people ever hear the voice of God speaking out of the middle of the fire, as you have heard, and live?
speaker: Narrator

text: Or has God tried to go and take a nation for himself from among another nation, by trials, by signs, by wonders, by war, by a mighty hand, by an outstretched arm, and by great terrors, according to all that Yahweh your God did for you in Egypt before your eyes?
speaker: Narrator

text: It was shown to you so that you might know that Yahweh is God. There is no one else besides him.
speaker: Narrator

text: Out of heaven he made you to hear his voice, that he might instruct you. On earth he made you to see his great fire; and you heard his words out of the middle of the fire.
speaker: Narrator

text: Because he loved your fathers, therefore he chose their offspring after them, and brought you out with his presence, with his great power, out of Egypt;
speaker: Narrator

text: to drive out nations from before you greater and mightier than you, to bring you in, to give you their land for an inheritance, as it is today.
speaker: Narrator

text: Know therefore today, and take it to heart, that Yahweh himself is God in heaven above and on the earth beneath. There is no one else.
speaker: Narrator

text: You shall keep his statutes and his commandments which I command you today, that it may go well with you and with your children after you, and that you may prolong your days in the land which Yahweh your God gives you for all time.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Moses set apart three cities beyond the Jordan toward the sunrise,
speaker: Narrator

text: that the man slayer might flee there, who kills his neighbor unintentionally and didn’t hate him in time past, and that fleeing to one of these cities he might live:
speaker: Narrator

text: Bezer in the wilderness, in the plain country, for the Reubenites; and Ramoth in Gilead for the Gadites; and Golan in Bashan for the Manassites.
speaker: Narrator

text: This is the law which Moses set before the children of Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: These are the testimonies, and the statutes, and the ordinances which Moses spoke to the children of Israel when they came out of Egypt,
speaker: Narrator

text: beyond the Jordan, in the valley opposite Beth Peor, in the land of Sihon king of the Amorites, who lived at Heshbon, whom Moses and the children of Israel struck when they came out of Egypt.
speaker: Narrator

text: They took possession of his land and the land of Og king of Bashan, the two kings of the Amorites, who were beyond the Jordan toward the sunrise;
speaker: Narrator

text: from Aroer, which is on the edge of the valley of the Arnon, even to Mount Zion (also called Hermon),
speaker: Narrator

text: and all the Arabah beyond the Jordan eastward, even to the sea of the Arabah, under the slopes of Pisgah.
speaker: Narrator

text: Moses called to all Israel, and said to them, “Hear, Israel, the statutes and the ordinances which I speak in your ears today, that you may learn them, and observe to do them.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Yahweh our God made a covenant with us in Horeb.
speaker: Narrator

text: Yahweh didn’t make this covenant with our fathers, but with us, even us, who are all of us here alive today.
speaker: Narrator

text: Yahweh spoke with you face to face on the mountain out of the middle of the fire,
speaker: Narrator

text: (I stood between Yahweh and you at that time, to show you Yahweh’s word; for you were afraid because of the fire, and didn’t go up onto the mountain) saying,
speaker: Narrator

text: “I am Yahweh your God, who brought you out of the land of Egypt, out of the house of bondage.
speaker: Narrator

text: “You shall have no other gods before me.
speaker: Narrator

text: “You shall not make a carved image for yourself—any likeness of what is in heaven above, or what is in the earth beneath, or that is in the water under the earth.
speaker: Narrator

text: You shall not bow yourself down to them, nor serve them, for I, Yahweh your God, am a jealous God, visiting the iniquity of the fathers on the children and on the third and on the fourth generation of those who hate me
speaker: Narrator

text: and showing loving kindness to thousands of those who love me and keep my commandments.
speaker: Narrator

text: “You shall not misuse the name of Yahweh your God; for Yahweh will not hold him guiltless who misuses his name.
speaker: Narrator

text: “Observe the Sabbath day, to keep it holy, as Yahweh your God commanded you.
speaker: Narrator

text: You shall labor six days, and do all your work;
speaker: Narrator

text: but the seventh day is a Sabbath to Yahweh your God, in which you shall not do any work—neither you, nor your son, nor your daughter, nor your male servant, nor your female servant, nor your ox, nor your donkey, nor any of your livestock, nor your stranger who is within your gates; that your male servant and your female servant may rest as well as you.
speaker: Narrator

text: You shall remember that you were a servant in the land of Egypt, and Yahweh your God brought you out of there by a mighty hand and by an outstretched arm. Therefore Yahweh your God commanded you to keep the Sabbath day.
speaker: Narrator

text: “Honor your father and your mother, as Yahweh your God commanded you, that your days may be long and that it may go well with you in the land which Yahweh your God gives you.
speaker: Narrator

text: “You shall not murder.
speaker: Narrator

text: “You shall not commit adultery.
speaker: Narrator

text: “You shall not steal.
speaker: Narrator

text: “You shall not give false testimony against your neighbor.
speaker: Narrator

text: “You shall not covet your neighbor’s wife. Neither shall you desire your neighbor’s house, his field, or his male servant, or his female servant, his ox, or his donkey, or anything that is your neighbor’s.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Yahweh spoke these words to all your assembly on the mountain out of the middle of the fire, of the cloud, and of the thick darkness, with a great voice. He added no more. He wrote them on two stone tablets, and gave them to me.
speaker: Narrator

text: When you heard the voice out of the middle of the darkness, while the mountain was burning with fire, you came near to me, even all the heads of your tribes, and your elders;
speaker: Narrator

text: and you said, “Behold, Yahweh our God has shown us his glory and his greatness, and we have heard his voice out of the middle of the fire. We have seen today that God does speak with man, and he lives.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now therefore, why should we die? For this great fire will consume us. If we hear Yahweh our God’s voice any more, then we shall die.
speaker: Narrator

text: For who is there of all flesh who has heard the voice of the living God speaking out of the middle of the fire, as we have, and lived?
speaker: Narrator

text: Go near, and hear all that Yahweh our God shall say, and tell us all that Yahweh our God tells you; and we will hear it, and do it.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Yahweh heard the voice of your words when you spoke to me; and Yahweh said to me, “I have heard the voice of the words of this people which they have spoken to you. They have well said all that they have spoken.
speaker: Narrator

text: Oh that there were such a heart in them that they would fear me and keep all my commandments always, that it might be well with them and with their children forever!
speaker: Narrator

text: “Go tell them, ‘Return to your tents.’
speaker: Narrator

text: But as for you, stand here by me, and I will tell you all the commandments, and the statutes, and the ordinances, which you shall teach them, that they may do them in the land which I give them to possess.”
speaker: Narrator

text: You shall observe to do therefore as Yahweh your God has commanded you. You shall not turn away to the right hand or to the left.
speaker: Narrator

text: You shall walk in all the way which Yahweh your God has commanded you, that you may live and that it may be well with you, and that you may prolong your days in the land which you shall possess.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now these are the commandments, the statutes, and the ordinances, which Yahweh your God commanded to teach you, that you might do them in the land that you go over to possess;
speaker: Narrator

text: that you might fear Yahweh your God, to keep all his statutes and his commandments, which I command you—you, your son, and your son’s son, all the days of your life; and that your days may be prolonged.
speaker: Narrator

text: Hear therefore, Israel, and observe to do it, that it may be well with you, and that you may increase mightily, as Yahweh, the God of your fathers, has promised to you, in a land flowing with milk and honey.
speaker: Narrator

text: Hear, Israel: Yahweh is our God. Yahweh is one.
speaker: Narrator

text: You shall love Yahweh your God with all your heart, with all your soul, and with all your might.
speaker: Narrator

text: These words, which I command you today, shall be on your heart;
speaker: Narrator

text: and you shall teach them diligently to your children, and shall talk of them when you sit in your house, and when you walk by the way, and when you lie down, and when you rise up.
speaker: Narrator

text: You shall bind them for a sign on your hand, and they shall be for frontlets between your eyes.
speaker: Narrator

text: You shall write them on the door posts of your house and on your gates.
speaker: Narrator

text: It shall be, when Yahweh your God brings you into the land which he swore to your fathers, to Abraham, to Isaac, and to Jacob, to give you, great and goodly cities which you didn’t build,
speaker: Narrator

text: and houses full of all good things which you didn’t fill, and cisterns dug out which you didn’t dig, vineyards and olive trees which you didn’t plant, and you shall eat and be full;
speaker: Narrator

text: then beware lest you forget Yahweh, who brought you out of the land of Egypt, out of the house of bondage.
speaker: Narrator

text: You shall fear Yahweh your God; and you shall serve him, and shall swear by his name.
speaker: Narrator

text: You shall not go after other gods, of the gods of the peoples who are around you,
speaker: Narrator

text: for Yahweh your God among you is a jealous God, lest the anger of Yahweh your God be kindled against you, and he destroy you from off the face of the earth.
speaker: Narrator

text: You shall not tempt Yahweh your God, as you tempted him in Massah.
speaker: Narrator

text: You shall diligently keep the commandments of Yahweh your God, and his testimonies, and his statutes, which he has commanded you.
speaker: Narrator

text: You shall do that which is right and good in Yahweh’s sight, that it may be well with you and that you may go in and possess the good land which Yahweh swore to your fathers,
speaker: Narrator

text: to thrust out all your enemies from before you, as Yahweh has spoken.
speaker: Narrator

text: When your son asks you in time to come, saying, “What do the testimonies, the statutes, and the ordinances, which Yahweh our God has commanded you mean?”
speaker: Narrator

text: then you shall tell your son, “We were Pharaoh’s slaves in Egypt. Yahweh brought us out of Egypt with a mighty hand;
speaker: Narrator

text: and Yahweh showed great and awesome signs and wonders on Egypt, on Pharaoh, and on all his house, before our eyes;
speaker: Narrator

text: and he brought us out from there, that he might bring us in, to give us the land which he swore to our fathers.
speaker: Narrator

text: Yahweh commanded us to do all these statutes, to fear Yahweh our God, for our good always, that he might preserve us alive, as we are today.
speaker: Narrator

text: It shall be righteousness to us, if we observe to do all these commandments before Yahweh our God, as he has commanded us.”
speaker: Narrator

text: When Yahweh your God brings you into the land where you go to possess it, and casts out many nations before you—the Hittite, the Girgashite, the Amorite, the Canaanite, the Perizzite, the Hivite, and the Jebusite—seven nations greater and mightier than you;
speaker: Narrator

text: and when Yahweh your God delivers them up before you, and you strike them, then you shall utterly destroy them. You shall make no covenant with them, nor show mercy to them.
speaker: Narrator

text: You shall not make marriages with them. You shall not give your daughter to his son, nor shall you take his daughter for your son.
speaker: Narrator

text: For that would turn away your sons from following me, that they may serve other gods. So Yahweh’s anger would be kindled against you, and he would destroy you quickly.
speaker: Narrator

text: But you shall deal with them like this: you shall break down their altars, dash their pillars in pieces, cut down their Asherah poles, and burn their engraved images with fire.
speaker: Narrator

text: For you are a holy people to Yahweh your God. Yahweh your God has chosen you to be a people for his own possession, above all peoples who are on the face of the earth.
speaker: Narrator

text: Yahweh didn’t set his love on you nor choose you, because you were more in number than any people; for you were the fewest of all peoples;
speaker: Narrator

text: but because Yahweh loves you, and because he desires to keep the oath which he swore to your fathers, Yahweh has brought you out with a mighty hand and redeemed you out of the house of bondage, from the hand of Pharaoh king of Egypt.
speaker: Narrator

text: Know therefore that Yahweh your God himself is God, the faithful God, who keeps covenant and loving kindness to a thousand generations with those who love him and keep his commandments,
speaker: Narrator

text: and repays those who hate him to their face, to destroy them. He will not be slack to him who hates him. He will repay him to his face.
speaker: Narrator

text: You shall therefore keep the commandments, the statutes, and the ordinances which I command you today, to do them.
speaker: Narrator

text: It shall happen, because you listen to these ordinances and keep and do them, that Yahweh your God will keep with you the covenant and the loving kindness which he swore to your fathers.
speaker: Narrator

text: He will love you, bless you, and multiply you. He will also bless the fruit of your body and the fruit of your ground, your grain and your new wine and your oil, the increase of your livestock and the young of your flock, in the land which he swore to your fathers to give you.
speaker: Narrator

text: You will be blessed above all peoples. There won’t be male or female barren among you, or among your livestock.
speaker: Narrator

text: Yahweh will take away from you all sickness; and he will put none of the evil diseases of Egypt, which you know, on you, but will lay them on all those who hate you.
speaker: Narrator

text: You shall consume all the peoples whom Yahweh your God shall deliver to you. Your eye shall not pity them. You shall not serve their gods; for that would be a snare to you.
speaker: Narrator

text: If you shall say in your heart, “These nations are more than I; how can I dispossess them?”
speaker: Narrator

text: you shall not be afraid of them. You shall remember well what Yahweh your God did to Pharaoh and to all Egypt:
speaker: Narrator

text: the great trials which your eyes saw, the signs, the wonders, the mighty hand, and the outstretched arm, by which Yahweh your God brought you out. So shall Yahweh your God do to all the peoples of whom you are afraid.
speaker: Narrator

text: Moreover Yahweh your God will send the hornet among them, until those who are left, and hide themselves, perish from before you.
speaker: Narrator

text: You shall not be scared of them; for Yahweh your God is among you, a great and awesome God.
speaker: Narrator

text: Yahweh your God will cast out those nations before you little by little. You may not consume them at once, lest the animals of the field increase on you.
speaker: Narrator

text: But Yahweh your God will deliver them up before you, and will confuse them with a great confusion, until they are destroyed.
speaker: Narrator

text: He will deliver their kings into your hand, and you shall make their name perish from under the sky. No one will be able to stand before you until you have destroyed them.
speaker: Narrator

text: You shall burn the engraved images of their gods with fire. You shall not covet the silver or the gold that is on them, nor take it for yourself, lest you be snared in it; for it is an abomination to Yahweh your God.
speaker: Narrator

text: You shall not bring an abomination into your house and become a devoted thing like it. You shall utterly detest it. You shall utterly abhor it; for it is a devoted thing.
speaker: Narrator

text: You shall observe to do all the commandments which I command you today, that you may live, and multiply, and go in and possess the land which Yahweh swore to your fathers.
speaker: Narrator

text: You shall remember all the way which Yahweh your God has led you these forty years in the wilderness, that he might humble you, to test you, to know what was in your heart, whether you would keep his commandments or not.
speaker: Narrator

text: He humbled you, allowed you to be hungry, and fed you with manna, which you didn’t know, neither did your fathers know, that he might teach you that man does not live by bread only, but man lives by every word that proceeds out of Yahweh’s mouth.
speaker: Narrator

text: Your clothing didn’t grow old on you, neither did your foot swell, these forty years.
speaker: Narrator

text: You shall consider in your heart that as a man disciplines his son, so Yahweh your God disciplines you.
speaker: Narrator

text: You shall keep the commandments of Yahweh your God, to walk in his ways, and to fear him.
speaker: Narrator

text: For Yahweh your God brings you into a good land, a land of brooks of water, of springs, and underground water flowing into valleys and hills;
speaker: Narrator

text: a land of wheat, barley, vines, fig trees, and pomegranates; a land of olive trees and honey;
speaker: Narrator

text: a land in which you shall eat bread without scarcity, you shall not lack anything in it; a land whose stones are iron, and out of whose hills you may dig copper.
speaker: Narrator

text: You shall eat and be full, and you shall bless Yahweh your God for the good land which he has given you.
speaker: Narrator

text: Beware lest you forget Yahweh your God, in not keeping his commandments, his ordinances, and his statutes, which I command you today;
speaker: Narrator

text: lest, when you have eaten and are full, and have built fine houses and lived in them;
speaker: Narrator

text: and when your herds and your flocks multiply, and your silver and your gold is multiplied, and all that you have is multiplied;
speaker: Narrator

text: then your heart might be lifted up, and you forget Yahweh your God, who brought you out of the land of Egypt, out of the house of bondage;
speaker: Narrator

text: who led you through the great and terrible wilderness, with venomous snakes and scorpions, and thirsty ground where there was no water; who poured water for you out of the rock of flint;
speaker: Narrator

text: who fed you in the wilderness with manna, which your fathers didn’t know, that he might humble you, and that he might prove you, to do you good at your latter end;
speaker: Narrator

text: and lest you say in your heart, “My power and the might of my hand has gotten me this wealth.”
speaker: Narrator

text: But you shall remember Yahweh your God, for it is he who gives you power to get wealth, that he may establish his covenant which he swore to your fathers, as it is today.
speaker: Narrator

text: It shall be, if you shall forget Yahweh your God, and walk after other gods, and serve them and worship them, I testify against you today that you shall surely perish.
speaker: Narrator

text: As the nations that Yahweh makes to perish before you, so you shall perish, because you wouldn’t listen to Yahweh your God’s voice.
speaker: Narrator

text: Hear, Israel! You are to pass over the Jordan today, to go in to dispossess nations greater and mightier than yourself, cities great and fortified up to the sky,
speaker: Narrator

text: a people great and tall, the sons of the Anakim, whom you know, and of whom you have heard say, “Who can stand before the sons of Anak?”
speaker: Narrator

text: Know therefore today that Yahweh your God is he who goes over before you as a devouring fire. He will destroy them and he will bring them down before you. So you shall drive them out and make them perish quickly, as Yahweh has spoken to you.
speaker: Narrator

text: Don’t say in your heart, after Yahweh your God has thrust them out from before you, “For my righteousness Yahweh has brought me in to possess this land;” because Yahweh drives them out before you because of the wickedness of these nations.
speaker: Narrator

text: Not for your righteousness or for the uprightness of your heart do you go in to possess their land; but for the wickedness of these nations Yahweh your God does drive them out from before you, and that he may establish the word which Yahweh swore to your fathers, to Abraham, to Isaac, and to Jacob.
speaker: Narrator

text: Know therefore that Yahweh your God doesn’t give you this good land to possess for your righteousness, for you are a stiff-necked people.
speaker: Narrator

text: Remember, and don’t forget, how you provoked Yahweh your God to wrath in the wilderness. From the day that you left the land of Egypt until you came to this place, you have been rebellious against Yahweh.
speaker: Narrator

text: Also in Horeb you provoked Yahweh to wrath, and Yahweh was angry with you to destroy you.
speaker: Narrator

text: When I had gone up onto the mountain to receive the stone tablets, even the tablets of the covenant which Yahweh made with you, then I stayed on the mountain forty days and forty nights. I neither ate bread nor drank water.
speaker: Narrator

text: Yahweh delivered to me the two stone tablets written with God’s finger. On them were all the words which Yahweh spoke with you on the mountain out of the middle of the fire in the day of the assembly.
speaker: Narrator

text: It came to pass at the end of forty days and forty nights that Yahweh gave me the two stone tablets, even the tablets of the covenant.
speaker: Narrator

text: Yahweh said to me, “Arise, get down quickly from here; for your people whom you have brought out of Egypt have corrupted themselves. They have quickly turned away from the way which I commanded them. They have made a molten image for themselves!”
speaker: Narrator

text: Furthermore Yahweh spoke to me, saying, “I have seen these people, and behold, they are a stiff-necked people.
speaker: Narrator

text: Leave me alone, that I may destroy them, and blot out their name from under the sky; and I will make of you a nation mightier and greater than they.”
speaker: Narrator

text: So I turned and came down from the mountain, and the mountain was burning with fire. The two tablets of the covenant were in my two hands.
speaker: Narrator

text: I looked, and behold, you had sinned against Yahweh your God. You had made yourselves a molded calf. You had quickly turned away from the way which Yahweh had commanded you.
speaker: Narrator

text: I took hold of the two tablets, and threw them out of my two hands, and broke them before your eyes.
speaker: Narrator

text: I fell down before Yahweh, as at the first, forty days and forty nights. I neither ate bread nor drank water, because of all your sin which you sinned, in doing that which was evil in Yahweh’s sight, to provoke him to anger.
speaker: Narrator

text: For I was afraid of the anger and hot displeasure with which Yahweh was angry against you to destroy you. But Yahweh listened to me that time also.
speaker: Narrator

text: Yahweh was angry enough with Aaron to destroy him. I prayed for Aaron also at the same time.
speaker: Narrator

text: I took your sin, the calf which you had made, and burned it with fire, and crushed it, grinding it very small, until it was as fine as dust. I threw its dust into the brook that descended out of the mountain.
speaker: Narrator

text: At Taberah, at Massah, and at Kibroth Hattaavah you provoked Yahweh to wrath.
speaker: Narrator

text: When Yahweh sent you from Kadesh Barnea, saying, “Go up and possess the land which I have given you,” you rebelled against the commandment of Yahweh your God, and you didn’t believe him or listen to his voice.
speaker: Narrator

text: You have been rebellious against Yahweh from the day that I knew you.
speaker: Narrator

text: So I fell down before Yahweh the forty days and forty nights that I fell down, because Yahweh had said he would destroy you.
speaker: Narrator

text: I prayed to Yahweh, and said, “Lord Yahweh, don’t destroy your people and your inheritance that you have redeemed through your greatness, that you have brought out of Egypt with a mighty hand.
speaker: Narrator

text: Remember your servants, Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob. Don’t look at the stubbornness of this people, nor at their wickedness, nor at their sin,
speaker: Narrator

text: lest the land you brought us out from say, ‘Because Yahweh was not able to bring them into the land which he promised to them, and because he hated them, he has brought them out to kill them in the wilderness.’
speaker: Narrator

text: Yet they are your people and your inheritance, which you brought out by your great power and by your outstretched arm.”
speaker: Narrator

text: At that time Yahweh said to me, “Cut two stone tablets like the first, and come up to me onto the mountain, and make an ark of wood.
speaker: Narrator

text: I will write on the tablets the words that were on the first tablets which you broke, and you shall put them in the ark.”
speaker: Narrator

text: So I made an ark of acacia wood, and cut two stone tablets like the first, and went up onto the mountain, having the two tablets in my hand.
speaker: Narrator

text: He wrote on the tablets, according to the first writing, the ten commandments, which Yahweh spoke to you on the mountain out of the middle of the fire in the day of the assembly; and Yahweh gave them to me.
speaker: Narrator

text: I turned and came down from the mountain, and put the tablets in the ark which I had made; and there they are as Yahweh commanded me.
speaker: Narrator

text: (The children of Israel traveled from Beeroth Bene Jaakan to Moserah. There Aaron died, and there he was buried; and Eleazar his son ministered in the priest’s office in his place.
speaker: Narrator

text: From there they traveled to Gudgodah; and from Gudgodah to Jotbathah, a land of brooks of water.
speaker: Narrator

text: At that time Yahweh set apart the tribe of Levi to bear the ark of Yahweh’s covenant, to stand before Yahweh to minister to him, and to bless in his name, to this day.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore Levi has no portion nor inheritance with his brothers; Yahweh is his inheritance, according as Yahweh your God spoke to him.)
speaker: Narrator

text: I stayed on the mountain, as at the first time, forty days and forty nights; and Yahweh listened to me that time also. Yahweh would not destroy you.
speaker: Narrator

text: Yahweh said to me, “Arise, take your journey before the people; and they shall go in and possess the land which I swore to their fathers to give to them.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Now, Israel, what does Yahweh your God require of you, but to fear Yahweh your God, to walk in all his ways, to love him, and to serve Yahweh your God with all your heart and with all your soul,
speaker: Narrator

text: to keep Yahweh’s commandments and statutes, which I command you today for your good?
speaker: Narrator

text: Behold, to Yahweh your God belongs heaven, the heaven of heavens, and the earth, with all that is therein.
speaker: Narrator

text: Only Yahweh had a delight in your fathers to love them, and he chose their offspring after them, even you above all peoples, as it is today.
speaker: Narrator

text: Circumcise therefore the foreskin of your heart, and be no more stiff-necked.
speaker: Narrator

text: For Yahweh your God, he is God of gods and Lord of lords, the great God, the mighty, and the awesome, who doesn’t respect persons or take bribes.
speaker: Narrator

text: He executes justice for the fatherless and widow and loves the foreigner in giving him food and clothing.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore love the foreigner, for you were foreigners in the land of Egypt.
speaker: Narrator

text: You shall fear Yahweh your God. You shall serve him. You shall cling to him, and you shall swear by his name.
speaker: Narrator

text: He is your praise, and he is your God, who has done for you these great and awesome things which your eyes have seen.
speaker: Narrator

text: Your fathers went down into Egypt with seventy persons; and now Yahweh your God has made you as the stars of the sky for multitude.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore you shall love Yahweh your God, and keep his instructions, his statutes, his ordinances, and his commandments, always.
speaker: Narrator

text: Know this day—for I don’t speak with your children who have not known, and who have not seen the chastisement of Yahweh your God, his greatness, his mighty hand, his outstretched arm,
speaker: Narrator

text: his signs, and his works, which he did in the middle of Egypt to Pharaoh the king of Egypt, and to all his land;
speaker: Narrator

text: and what he did to the army of Egypt, to their horses, and to their chariots; how he made the water of the Red Sea to overflow them as they pursued you, and how Yahweh has destroyed them to this day;
speaker: Narrator

text: and what he did to you in the wilderness until you came to this place;
speaker: Narrator

text: and what he did to Dathan and Abiram, the sons of Eliab, the son of Reuben—how the earth opened its mouth and swallowed them up, with their households, their tents, and every living thing that followed them, in the middle of all Israel;
speaker: Narrator

text: but your eyes have seen all of Yahweh’s great work which he did.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore you shall keep the entire commandment which I command you today, that you may be strong, and go in and possess the land that you go over to possess;
speaker: Narrator

text: and that you may prolong your days in the land which Yahweh swore to your fathers to give to them and to their offspring, a land flowing with milk and honey.
speaker: Narrator

text: For the land, where you go in to possess isn’t like the land of Egypt that you came out of, where you sowed your seed and watered it with your foot, as a garden of herbs;
speaker: Narrator

text: but the land that you go over to possess is a land of hills and valleys which drinks water from the rain of the sky,
speaker: Narrator

text: a land which Yahweh your God cares for. Yahweh your God’s eyes are always on it, from the beginning of the year even to the end of the year.
speaker: Narrator

text: It shall happen, if you shall listen diligently to my commandments which I command you today, to love Yahweh your God, and to serve him with all your heart and with all your soul,
speaker: Narrator

text: that I will give the rain for your land in its season, the early rain and the latter rain, that you may gather in your grain, your new wine, and your oil.
speaker: Narrator

text: I will give grass in your fields for your livestock, and you shall eat and be full.
speaker: Narrator

text: Be careful, lest your heart be deceived, and you turn away to serve other gods and worship them;
speaker: Narrator

text: and Yahweh’s anger be kindled against you, and he shut up the sky so that there is no rain, and the land doesn’t yield its fruit; and you perish quickly from off the good land which Yahweh gives you.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore you shall lay up these words of mine in your heart and in your soul. You shall bind them for a sign on your hand, and they shall be for frontlets between your eyes.
speaker: Narrator

text: You shall teach them to your children, talking of them when you sit in your house, when you walk by the way, when you lie down, and when you rise up.
speaker: Narrator

text: You shall write them on the door posts of your house and on your gates;
speaker: Narrator

text: that your days and your children’s days may be multiplied in the land which Yahweh swore to your fathers to give them, as the days of the heavens above the earth.
speaker: Narrator

text: For if you shall diligently keep all these commandments which I command you—to do them, to love Yahweh your God, to walk in all his ways, and to cling to him—
speaker: Narrator

text: then Yahweh will drive out all these nations from before you, and you shall dispossess nations greater and mightier than yourselves.
speaker: Narrator

text: Every place on which the sole of your foot treads shall be yours: from the wilderness and Lebanon, from the river, the river Euphrates, even to the western sea shall be your border.
speaker: Narrator

text: No man will be able to stand before you. Yahweh your God will lay the fear of you and the dread of you on all the land that you tread on, as he has spoken to you.
speaker: Narrator

text: Behold, I set before you today a blessing and a curse:
speaker: Narrator

text: the blessing, if you listen to the commandments of Yahweh your God, which I command you today;
speaker: Narrator

text: and the curse, if you do not listen to the commandments of Yahweh your God, but turn away out of the way which I command you today, to go after other gods which you have not known.
speaker: Narrator

text: It shall happen, when Yahweh your God brings you into the land that you go to possess, that you shall set the blessing on Mount Gerizim, and the curse on Mount Ebal.
speaker: Narrator

text: Aren’t they beyond the Jordan, behind the way of the going down of the sun, in the land of the Canaanites who dwell in the Arabah near Gilgal, beside the oaks of Moreh?
speaker: Narrator

text: For you are to pass over the Jordan to go in to possess the land which Yahweh your God gives you, and you shall possess it and dwell in it.
speaker: Narrator

text: You shall observe to do all the statutes and the ordinances which I set before you today.
speaker: Narrator

text: These are the statutes and the ordinances which you shall observe to do in the land which Yahweh, the God of your fathers, has given you to possess all the days that you live on the earth.
speaker: Narrator

text: You shall surely destroy all the places in which the nations that you shall dispossess served their gods: on the high mountains, and on the hills, and under every green tree.
speaker: Narrator

text: You shall break down their altars, dash their pillars in pieces, and burn their Asherah poles with fire. You shall cut down the engraved images of their gods. You shall destroy their name out of that place.
speaker: Narrator

text: You shall not do so to Yahweh your God.
speaker: Narrator

text: But to the place which Yahweh your God shall choose out of all your tribes, to put his name there, you shall seek his habitation, and you shall come there.
speaker: Narrator

text: You shall bring your burnt offerings, your sacrifices, your tithes, the wave offering of your hand, your vows, your free will offerings, and the firstborn of your herd and of your flock there.
speaker: Narrator

text: There you shall eat before Yahweh your God, and you shall rejoice in all that you put your hand to, you and your households, in which Yahweh your God has blessed you.
speaker: Narrator

text: You shall not do all the things that we do here today, every man whatever is right in his own eyes;
speaker: Narrator

text: for you haven’t yet come to the rest and to the inheritance which Yahweh your God gives you.
speaker: Narrator

text: But when you go over the Jordan and dwell in the land which Yahweh your God causes you to inherit, and he gives you rest from all your enemies around you, so that you dwell in safety,
speaker: Narrator

text: then it shall happen that to the place which Yahweh your God shall choose, to cause his name to dwell there, there you shall bring all that I command you: your burnt offerings, your sacrifices, your tithes, the wave offering of your hand, and all your choice vows which you vow to Yahweh.
speaker: Narrator

text: You shall rejoice before Yahweh your God—you, and your sons, your daughters, your male servants, your female servants, and the Levite who is within your gates, because he has no portion nor inheritance with you.
speaker: Narrator

text: Be careful that you don’t offer your burnt offerings in every place that you see;
speaker: Narrator

text: but in the place which Yahweh chooses in one of your tribes, there you shall offer your burnt offerings, and there you shall do all that I command you.
speaker: Narrator

text: Yet you may kill and eat meat within all your gates, after all the desire of your soul, according to Yahweh your God’s blessing which he has given you. The unclean and the clean may eat of it, as of the gazelle and the deer.
speaker: Narrator

text: Only you shall not eat the blood. You shall pour it out on the earth like water.
speaker: Narrator

text: You may not eat within your gates the tithe of your grain, or of your new wine, or of your oil, or the firstborn of your herd or of your flock, nor any of your vows which you vow, nor your free will offerings, nor the wave offering of your hand;
speaker: Narrator

text: but you shall eat them before Yahweh your God in the place which Yahweh your God shall choose: you, your son, your daughter, your male servant, your female servant, and the Levite who is within your gates. You shall rejoice before Yahweh your God in all that you put your hand to.
speaker: Narrator

text: Be careful that you don’t forsake the Levite as long as you live in your land.
speaker: Narrator

text: When Yahweh your God enlarges your border, as he has promised you, and you say, “I want to eat meat,” because your soul desires to eat meat, you may eat meat, after all the desire of your soul.
speaker: Narrator

text: If the place which Yahweh your God shall choose to put his name is too far from you, then you shall kill of your herd and of your flock, which Yahweh has given you, as I have commanded you; and you may eat within your gates, after all the desire of your soul.
speaker: Narrator

text: Even as the gazelle and as the deer is eaten, so you shall eat of it. The unclean and the clean may eat of it alike.
speaker: Narrator

text: Only be sure that you don’t eat the blood; for the blood is the life. You shall not eat the life with the meat.
speaker: Narrator

text: You shall not eat it. You shall pour it out on the earth like water.
speaker: Narrator

text: You shall not eat it, that it may go well with you and with your children after you, when you do that which is right in Yahweh’s eyes.
speaker: Narrator

text: Only your holy things which you have, and your vows, you shall take and go to the place which Yahweh shall choose.
speaker: Narrator

text: You shall offer your burnt offerings, the meat and the blood, on Yahweh your God’s altar. The blood of your sacrifices shall be poured out on Yahweh your God’s altar, and you shall eat the meat.
speaker: Narrator

text: Observe and hear all these words which I command you, that it may go well with you and with your children after you forever, when you do that which is good and right in Yahweh your God’s eyes.
speaker: Narrator

text: When Yahweh your God cuts off the nations from before you where you go in to dispossess them, and you dispossess them and dwell in their land,
speaker: Narrator

text: be careful that you are not ensnared to follow them after they are destroyed from before you, and that you not inquire after their gods, saying, “How do these nations serve their gods? I will do likewise.”
speaker: Narrator

text: You shall not do so to Yahweh your God; for every abomination to Yahweh, which he hates, they have done to their gods; for they even burn their sons and their daughters in the fire to their gods.
speaker: Narrator

text: Whatever thing I command you, that you shall observe to do. You shall not add to it, nor take away from it.
speaker: Narrator

text: If a prophet or a dreamer of dreams arises among you, and he gives you a sign or a wonder,
speaker: Narrator

text: and the sign or the wonder comes to pass, of which he spoke to you, saying, “Let’s go after other gods” (which you have not known) “and let’s serve them,”
speaker: Narrator

text: you shall not listen to the words of that prophet, or to that dreamer of dreams; for Yahweh your God is testing you, to know whether you love Yahweh your God with all your heart and with all your soul.
speaker: Narrator

text: You shall walk after Yahweh your God, fear him, keep his commandments, and obey his voice. You shall serve him, and cling to him.
speaker: Narrator

text: That prophet, or that dreamer of dreams, shall be put to death, because he has spoken rebellion against Yahweh your God, who brought you out of the land of Egypt and redeemed you out of the house of bondage, to draw you aside out of the way which Yahweh your God commanded you to walk in. So you shall remove the evil from among you.
speaker: Narrator

text: If your brother, the son of your mother, or your son, or your daughter, or the wife of your bosom, or your friend who is as your own soul, entices you secretly, saying, “Let’s go and serve other gods”—which you have not known, you, nor your fathers;
speaker: Narrator

text: of the gods of the peoples who are around you, near to you, or far off from you, from the one end of the earth even to the other end of the earth—
speaker: Narrator

text: you shall not consent to him nor listen to him; neither shall your eye pity him, neither shall you spare, neither shall you conceal him;
speaker: Narrator

text: but you shall surely kill him. Your hand shall be first on him to put him to death, and afterwards the hands of all the people.
speaker: Narrator

text: You shall stone him to death with stones, because he has sought to draw you away from Yahweh your God, who brought you out of the land of Egypt, out of the house of bondage.
speaker: Narrator

text: All Israel shall hear, and fear, and shall not do any more wickedness like this among you.
speaker: Narrator

text: If you hear about one of your cities, which Yahweh your God gives you to dwell there, that
speaker: Narrator

text: certain wicked fellows have gone out from among you and have drawn away the inhabitants of their city, saying, “Let’s go and serve other gods,” which you have not known,
speaker: Narrator

text: then you shall inquire, investigate, and ask diligently. Behold, if it is true, and the thing certain, that such abomination was done among you,
speaker: Narrator

text: you shall surely strike the inhabitants of that city with the edge of the sword, destroying it utterly, with all that is therein and its livestock, with the edge of the sword.
speaker: Narrator

text: You shall gather all its plunder into the middle of its street, and shall burn with fire the city, with all of its plunder, to Yahweh your God. It shall be a heap forever. It shall not be built again.
speaker: Narrator

text: Nothing of the devoted thing shall cling to your hand, that Yahweh may turn from the fierceness of his anger and show you mercy, and have compassion on you and multiply you, as he has sworn to your fathers,
speaker: Narrator

text: when you listen to Yahweh your God’s voice, to keep all his commandments which I command you today, to do that which is right in Yahweh your God’s eyes.
speaker: Narrator

text: You are the children of Yahweh your God. You shall not cut yourselves, nor make any baldness between your eyes for the dead.
speaker: Narrator

text: For you are a holy people to Yahweh your God, and Yahweh has chosen you to be a people for his own possession, above all peoples who are on the face of the earth.
speaker: Narrator

text: You shall not eat any abominable thing.
speaker: Narrator

text: These are the animals which you may eat: the ox, the sheep, the goat,
speaker: Narrator

text: the deer, the gazelle, the roebuck, the wild goat, the ibex, the antelope, and the chamois.
speaker: Narrator

text: Every animal that parts the hoof, and has the hoof split in two and chews the cud, among the animals, you may eat.
speaker: Narrator

text: Nevertheless these you shall not eat of them that chew the cud, or of those who have the hoof split: the camel, the hare, and the rabbit. Because they chew the cud but don’t part the hoof, they are unclean to you.
speaker: Narrator

text: The pig, because it has a split hoof but doesn’t chew the cud, is unclean to you. You shall not eat their meat. You shall not touch their carcasses.
speaker: Narrator

text: These you may eat of all that are in the waters: you may eat whatever has fins and scales.
speaker: Narrator

text: You shall not eat whatever doesn’t have fins and scales. It is unclean to you.
speaker: Narrator

text: Of all clean birds you may eat.
speaker: Narrator

text: But these are they of which you shall not eat: the eagle, the vulture, the osprey,
speaker: Narrator

text: the red kite, the falcon, the kite of any kind,
speaker: Narrator

text: every raven of any kind,
speaker: Narrator

text: the ostrich, the owl, the seagull, the hawk of any kind,
speaker: Narrator

text: the little owl, the great owl, the horned owl,
speaker: Narrator

text: the pelican, the vulture, the cormorant,
speaker: Narrator

text: the stork, the heron after its kind, the hoopoe, and the bat.
speaker: Narrator

text: All winged creeping things are unclean to you. They shall not be eaten.
speaker: Narrator

text: Of all clean birds you may eat.
speaker: Narrator

text:
You shall not eat of anything that dies of itself. You may give it to the foreigner living among you who is within your gates, that he may eat it; or you may sell it to a foreigner; for you are a holy people to Yahweh your God.
You shall not boil a young goat in its mother’s milk.
speaker: Narrator

text: You shall surely tithe all the increase of your seed, that which comes out of the field year by year.
speaker: Narrator

text: You shall eat before Yahweh your God, in the place which he chooses to cause his name to dwell, the tithe of your grain, of your new wine, and of your oil, and the firstborn of your herd and of your flock; that you may learn to fear Yahweh your God always.
speaker: Narrator

text: If the way is too long for you, so that you are not able to carry it because the place which Yahweh your God shall choose to set his name there is too far from you, when Yahweh your God blesses you,
speaker: Narrator

text: then you shall turn it into money, bind up the money in your hand, and shall go to the place which Yahweh your God shall choose.
speaker: Narrator

text: You shall trade the money for whatever your soul desires: for cattle, or for sheep, or for wine, or for strong drink, or for whatever your soul asks of you. You shall eat there before Yahweh your God, and you shall rejoice, you and your household.
speaker: Narrator

text: You shall not forsake the Levite who is within your gates, for he has no portion nor inheritance with you.
speaker: Narrator

text: At the end of every three years you shall bring all the tithe of your increase in the same year, and shall store it within your gates.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Levite, because he has no portion nor inheritance with you, as well as the foreigner living among you, the fatherless, and the widow who are within your gates shall come, and shall eat and be satisfied; that Yahweh your God may bless you in all the work of your hand which you do.
speaker: Narrator

text: At the end of every seven years, you shall cancel debts.
speaker: Narrator

text: This is the way it shall be done: every creditor shall release that which he has lent to his neighbor. He shall not require payment from his neighbor and his brother, because Yahweh’s release has been proclaimed.
speaker: Narrator

text: Of a foreigner you may require it; but whatever of yours is with your brother, your hand shall release.
speaker: Narrator

text: However there will be no poor with you (for Yahweh will surely bless you in the land which Yahweh your God gives you for an inheritance to possess)
speaker: Narrator

text: if only you diligently listen to Yahweh your God’s voice, to observe to do all this commandment which I command you today.
speaker: Narrator

text: For Yahweh your God will bless you, as he promised you. You will lend to many nations, but you will not borrow. You will rule over many nations, but they will not rule over you.
speaker: Narrator

text: If a poor man, one of your brothers, is with you within any of your gates in your land which Yahweh your God gives you, you shall not harden your heart, nor shut your hand from your poor brother;
speaker: Narrator

text: but you shall surely open your hand to him, and shall surely lend him sufficient for his need, which he lacks.
speaker: Narrator

text: Beware that there not be a wicked thought in your heart, saying, “The seventh year, the year of release, is at hand,” and your eye be evil against your poor brother and you give him nothing; and he cry to Yahweh against you, and it be sin to you.
speaker: Narrator

text: You shall surely give, and your heart shall not be grieved when you give to him, because it is for this thing Yahweh your God will bless you in all your work and in all that you put your hand to.
speaker: Narrator

text: For the poor will never cease out of the land. Therefore I command you to surely open your hand to your brother, to your needy, and to your poor, in your land.
speaker: Narrator

text: If your brother, a Hebrew man, or a Hebrew woman, is sold to you and serves you six years, then in the seventh year you shall let him go free from you.
speaker: Narrator

text: When you let him go free from you, you shall not let him go empty.
speaker: Narrator

text: You shall furnish him liberally out of your flock, out of your threshing floor, and out of your wine press. As Yahweh your God has blessed you, you shall give to him.
speaker: Narrator

text: You shall remember that you were a slave in the land of Egypt, and Yahweh your God redeemed you. Therefore I command you this thing today.
speaker: Narrator

text: It shall be, if he tells you, “I will not go out from you,” because he loves you and your house, because he is well with you,
speaker: Narrator

text: then you shall take an awl, and thrust it through his ear to the door, and he shall be your servant forever. Also to your female servant you shall do likewise.
speaker: Narrator

text: It shall not seem hard to you when you let him go free from you, for he has been double the value of a hired hand as he served you six years. Yahweh your God will bless you in all that you do.
speaker: Narrator

text: You shall dedicate all the firstborn males that are born of your herd and of your flock to Yahweh your God. You shall do no work with the firstborn of your herd, nor shear the firstborn of your flock.
speaker: Narrator

text: You shall eat it before Yahweh your God year by year in the place which Yahweh shall choose, you and your household.
speaker: Narrator

text: If it has any defect—is lame or blind, or has any defect whatever, you shall not sacrifice it to Yahweh your God.
speaker: Narrator

text: You shall eat it within your gates. The unclean and the clean shall eat it alike, as the gazelle and as the deer.
speaker: Narrator

text: Only you shall not eat its blood. You shall pour it out on the ground like water.
speaker: Narrator

text: Observe the month of Abib, and keep the Passover to Yahweh your God; for in the month of Abib Yahweh your God brought you out of Egypt by night.
speaker: Narrator

text: You shall sacrifice the Passover to Yahweh your God, of the flock and the herd, in the place which Yahweh shall choose to cause his name to dwell there.
speaker: Narrator

text: You shall eat no leavened bread with it. You shall eat unleavened bread with it seven days, even the bread of affliction (for you came out of the land of Egypt in haste) that you may remember the day when you came out of the land of Egypt all the days of your life.
speaker: Narrator

text: No yeast shall be seen with you in all your borders seven days; neither shall any of the meat, which you sacrifice the first day at evening, remain all night until the morning.
speaker: Narrator

text: You may not sacrifice the Passover within any of your gates which Yahweh your God gives you;
speaker: Narrator

text: but at the place which Yahweh your God shall choose to cause his name to dwell in, there you shall sacrifice the Passover at evening, at the going down of the sun, at the season that you came out of Egypt.
speaker: Narrator

text: You shall roast and eat it in the place which Yahweh your God chooses. In the morning you shall return to your tents.
speaker: Narrator

text: Six days you shall eat unleavened bread. On the seventh day shall be a solemn assembly to Yahweh your God. You shall do no work.
speaker: Narrator

text: You shall count for yourselves seven weeks. From the time you begin to put the sickle to the standing grain you shall begin to count seven weeks.
speaker: Narrator

text: You shall keep the feast of weeks to Yahweh your God with a tribute of a free will offering of your hand, which you shall give according to how Yahweh your God blesses you.
speaker: Narrator

text: You shall rejoice before Yahweh your God: you, your son, your daughter, your male servant, your female servant, the Levite who is within your gates, the foreigner, the fatherless, and the widow who are among you, in the place which Yahweh your God shall choose to cause his name to dwell there.
speaker: Narrator

text: You shall remember that you were a slave in Egypt. You shall observe and do these statutes.
speaker: Narrator

text: You shall keep the feast of booths seven days, after you have gathered in from your threshing floor and from your wine press.
speaker: Narrator

text: You shall rejoice in your feast, you, your son, your daughter, your male servant, your female servant, the Levite, the foreigner, the fatherless, and the widow who are within your gates.
speaker: Narrator

text: You shall keep a feast to Yahweh your God seven days in the place which Yahweh chooses, because Yahweh your God will bless you in all your increase and in all the work of your hands, and you shall be altogether joyful.
speaker: Narrator

text: Three times in a year all of your males shall appear before Yahweh your God in the place which he chooses: in the feast of unleavened bread, in the feast of weeks, and in the feast of booths. They shall not appear before Yahweh empty.
speaker: Narrator

text: Every man shall give as he is able, according to Yahweh your God’s blessing which he has given you.
speaker: Narrator

text: You shall make judges and officers in all your gates, which Yahweh your God gives you, according to your tribes; and they shall judge the people with righteous judgment.
speaker: Narrator

text: You shall not pervert justice. You shall not show partiality. You shall not take a bribe, for a bribe blinds the eyes of the wise and perverts the words of the righteous.
speaker: Narrator

text: You shall follow that which is altogether just, that you may live and inherit the land which Yahweh your God gives you.
speaker: Narrator
