text: You shall not plant for yourselves an Asherah of any kind of tree beside Yahweh your God’s altar, which you shall make for yourselves.
speaker: Narrator

text: Neither shall you set yourself up a sacred stone which Yahweh your God hates.
speaker: Narrator

text: You shall not sacrifice to Yahweh your God an ox or a sheep in which is a defect or anything evil; for that is an abomination to Yahweh your God.
speaker: Narrator

text: If there is found among you, within any of your gates which Yahweh your God gives you, a man or woman who does that which is evil in Yahweh your God’s sight in transgressing his covenant,
speaker: Narrator

text: and has gone and served other gods and worshiped them, or the sun, or the moon, or any of the stars of the sky, which I have not commanded,
speaker: Narrator

text: and you are told, and you have heard of it, then you shall inquire diligently. Behold, if it is true, and the thing certain, that such abomination is done in Israel,
speaker: Narrator

text: then you shall bring out that man or that woman who has done this evil thing to your gates, even that same man or woman; and you shall stone them to death with stones.
speaker: Narrator

text: At the mouth of two witnesses, or three witnesses, he who is to die shall be put to death. At the mouth of one witness he shall not be put to death.
speaker: Narrator

text: The hands of the witnesses shall be first on him to put him to death, and afterward the hands of all the people. So you shall remove the evil from among you.
speaker: Narrator

text: If there arises a matter too hard for you in judgment, between blood and blood, between plea and plea, and between stroke and stroke, being matters of controversy within your gates, then you shall arise, and go up to the place which Yahweh your God chooses.
speaker: Narrator

text: You shall come to the priests who are Levites and to the judge who shall be in those days. You shall inquire, and they shall give you the verdict.
speaker: Narrator

text: You shall do according to the decisions of the verdict which they shall give you from that place which Yahweh chooses. You shall observe to do according to all that they shall teach you.
speaker: Narrator

text: According to the decisions of the law which they shall teach you, and according to the judgment which they shall tell you, you shall do. You shall not turn away from the sentence which they announce to you, to the right hand, nor to the left.
speaker: Narrator

text: The man who does presumptuously in not listening to the priest who stands to minister there before Yahweh your God, or to the judge, even that man shall die. You shall put away the evil from Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: All the people shall hear and fear, and do no more presumptuously.
speaker: Narrator

text: When you have come to the land which Yahweh your God gives you, and possess it and dwell in it, and say, “I will set a king over me, like all the nations that are around me,”
speaker: Narrator

text: you shall surely set him whom Yahweh your God chooses as king over yourselves. You shall set as king over you one from among your brothers. You may not put a foreigner over you, who is not your brother.
speaker: Narrator

text: Only he shall not multiply horses to himself, nor cause the people to return to Egypt, to the end that he may multiply horses; because Yahweh has said to you, “You shall not go back that way again.”
speaker: Narrator

text: He shall not multiply wives to himself, that his heart not turn away. He shall not greatly multiply to himself silver and gold.
speaker: Narrator

text: It shall be, when he sits on the throne of his kingdom, that he shall write himself a copy of this law in a book, out of that which is before the Levitical priests.
speaker: Narrator

text: It shall be with him, and he shall read from it all the days of his life, that he may learn to fear Yahweh his God, to keep all the words of this law and these statutes, to do them;
speaker: Narrator

text: that his heart not be lifted up above his brothers, and that he not turn away from the commandment to the right hand, or to the left, to the end that he may prolong his days in his kingdom, he and his children, in the middle of Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: The priests and the Levites—all the tribe of Levi—shall have no portion nor inheritance with Israel. They shall eat the offerings of Yahweh made by fire and his portion.
speaker: Narrator

text: They shall have no inheritance among their brothers. Yahweh is their inheritance, as he has spoken to them.
speaker: Narrator

text: This shall be the priests’ due from the people, from those who offer a sacrifice, whether it be ox or sheep, that they shall give to the priest: the shoulder, the two cheeks, and the inner parts.
speaker: Narrator

text: You shall give him the first fruits of your grain, of your new wine, and of your oil, and the first of the fleece of your sheep.
speaker: Narrator

text: For Yahweh your God has chosen him out of all your tribes to stand to minister in Yahweh’s name, him and his sons forever.
speaker: Narrator

text: If a Levite comes from any of your gates out of all Israel where he lives, and comes with all the desire of his soul to the place which Yahweh shall choose,
speaker: Narrator

text: then he shall minister in the name of Yahweh his God, as all his brothers the Levites do, who stand there before Yahweh.
speaker: Narrator

text: They shall have like portions to eat, in addition to that which comes from the sale of his family possessions.
speaker: Narrator

text: When you have come into the land which Yahweh your God gives you, you shall not learn to imitate the abominations of those nations.
speaker: Narrator

text: There shall not be found with you anyone who makes his son or his daughter to pass through the fire, one who uses divination, one who tells fortunes, or an enchanter, or a sorcerer,
speaker: Narrator

text: or a charmer, or someone who consults with a familiar spirit, or a wizard, or a necromancer.
speaker: Narrator

text: For whoever does these things is an abomination to Yahweh. Because of these abominations, Yahweh your God drives them out from before you.
speaker: Narrator

text: You shall be blameless with Yahweh your God.
speaker: Narrator

text: For these nations that you shall dispossess listen to those who practice sorcery and to diviners; but as for you, Yahweh your God has not allowed you so to do.
speaker: Narrator

text: Yahweh your God will raise up to you a prophet from among you, of your brothers, like me. You shall listen to him.
speaker: Narrator

text: This is according to all that you desired of Yahweh your God in Horeb in the day of the assembly, saying, “Let me not hear again Yahweh my God’s voice, neither let me see this great fire any more, that I not die.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Yahweh said to me, “They have well said that which they have spoken.
speaker: Narrator

text: I will raise them up a prophet from among their brothers, like you. I will put my words in his mouth, and he shall speak to them all that I shall command him.
speaker: Narrator

text: It shall happen, that whoever will not listen to my words which he shall speak in my name, I will require it of him.
speaker: Narrator

text: But the prophet who speaks a word presumptuously in my name, which I have not commanded him to speak, or who speaks in the name of other gods, that same prophet shall die.”
speaker: Narrator

text: You may say in your heart, “How shall we know the word which Yahweh has not spoken?”
speaker: Narrator

text: When a prophet speaks in Yahweh’s name, if the thing doesn’t follow, nor happen, that is the thing which Yahweh has not spoken. The prophet has spoken it presumptuously. You shall not be afraid of him.
speaker: Narrator

text: When Yahweh your God cuts off the nations whose land Yahweh your God gives you, and you succeed them and dwell in their cities and in their houses,
speaker: Narrator

text: you shall set apart three cities for yourselves in the middle of your land, which Yahweh your God gives you to possess.
speaker: Narrator

text: You shall prepare the way, and divide the borders of your land which Yahweh your God causes you to inherit into three parts, that every man slayer may flee there.
speaker: Narrator

text: This is the case of the man slayer who shall flee there and live: Whoever kills his neighbor unintentionally, and didn’t hate him in time past—
speaker: Narrator

text: as when a man goes into the forest with his neighbor to chop wood and his hand swings the ax to cut down the tree, and the head slips from the handle and hits his neighbor so that he dies—he shall flee to one of these cities and live.
speaker: Narrator

text: Otherwise, the avenger of blood might pursue the man slayer while hot anger is in his heart and overtake him, because the way is long, and strike him mortally, even though he was not worthy of death, because he didn’t hate him in time past.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore I command you to set apart three cities for yourselves.
speaker: Narrator

text: If Yahweh your God enlarges your border, as he has sworn to your fathers, and gives you all the land which he promised to give to your fathers;
speaker: Narrator

text: and if you keep all this commandment to do it, which I command you today, to love Yahweh your God, and to walk ever in his ways, then you shall add three cities more for yourselves, in addition to these three.
speaker: Narrator

text: This is so that innocent blood will not be shed in the middle of your land which Yahweh your God gives you for an inheritance, leaving blood guilt on you.
speaker: Narrator

text: But if any man hates his neighbor, lies in wait for him, rises up against him, strikes him mortally so that he dies, and he flees into one of these cities;
speaker: Narrator

text: then the elders of his city shall send and bring him there, and deliver him into the hand of the avenger of blood, that he may die.
speaker: Narrator

text: Your eye shall not pity him, but you shall purge the innocent blood from Israel that it may go well with you.
speaker: Narrator

text: You shall not remove your neighbor’s landmark, which they of old time have set, in your inheritance which you shall inherit, in the land that Yahweh your God gives you to possess.
speaker: Narrator

text: One witness shall not rise up against a man for any iniquity, or for any sin that he sins. At the mouth of two witnesses, or at the mouth of three witnesses, shall a matter be established.
speaker: Narrator

text: If an unrighteous witness rises up against any man to testify against him of wrongdoing,
speaker: Narrator

text: then both the men, between whom the controversy is, shall stand before Yahweh, before the priests and the judges who shall be in those days;
speaker: Narrator

text: and the judges shall make diligent inquisition; and behold, if the witness is a false witness, and has testified falsely against his brother,
speaker: Narrator

text: then you shall do to him as he had thought to do to his brother. So you shall remove the evil from among you.
speaker: Narrator

text: Those who remain shall hear, and fear, and will never again commit any such evil among you.
speaker: Narrator

text: Your eyes shall not pity: life for life, eye for eye, tooth for tooth, hand for hand, foot for foot.
speaker: Narrator

text: When you go out to battle against your enemies, and see horses, chariots, and a people more numerous than you, you shall not be afraid of them; for Yahweh your God, who brought you up out of the land of Egypt, is with you.
speaker: Narrator

text: It shall be, when you draw near to the battle, that the priest shall approach and speak to the people,
speaker: Narrator

text: and shall tell them, “Hear, Israel, you draw near today to battle against your enemies. Don’t let your heart faint! Don’t be afraid, nor tremble, neither be scared of them;
speaker: Narrator

text: for Yahweh your God is he who goes with you, to fight for you against your enemies, to save you.”
speaker: Narrator

text: The officers shall speak to the people, saying, “What man is there who has built a new house, and has not dedicated it? Let him go and return to his house, lest he die in the battle, and another man dedicate it.
speaker: Narrator

text: What man is there who has planted a vineyard, and has not used its fruit? Let him go and return to his house, lest he die in the battle, and another man use its fruit.
speaker: Narrator

text: What man is there who has pledged to be married to a wife, and has not taken her? Let him go and return to his house, lest he die in the battle, and another man take her.”
speaker: Narrator

text: The officers shall speak further to the people, and they shall say, “What man is there who is fearful and faint-hearted? Let him go and return to his house, lest his brother’s heart melt as his heart.”
speaker: Narrator

text: It shall be, when the officers have finished speaking to the people, that they shall appoint captains of armies at the head of the people.
speaker: Narrator

text: When you draw near to a city to fight against it, then proclaim peace to it.
speaker: Narrator

text: It shall be, if it gives you answer of peace and opens to you, then it shall be that all the people who are found therein shall become forced laborers to you, and shall serve you.
speaker: Narrator

text: If it will make no peace with you, but will make war against you, then you shall besiege it.
speaker: Narrator

text: When Yahweh your God delivers it into your hand, you shall strike every male of it with the edge of the sword;
speaker: Narrator

text: but the women, the little ones, the livestock, and all that is in the city, even all its plunder, you shall take for plunder for yourself. You may use the plunder of your enemies, which Yahweh your God has given you.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thus you shall do to all the cities which are very far off from you, which are not of the cities of these nations.
speaker: Narrator

text: But of the cities of these peoples that Yahweh your God gives you for an inheritance, you shall save alive nothing that breathes;
speaker: Narrator

text: but you shall utterly destroy them: the Hittite, the Amorite, the Canaanite, the Perizzite, the Hivite, and the Jebusite, as Yahweh your God has commanded you;
speaker: Narrator

text: that they not teach you to follow all their abominations, which they have done for their gods; so would you sin against Yahweh your God.
speaker: Narrator

text: When you shall besiege a city a long time, in making war against it to take it, you shall not destroy its trees by wielding an ax against them; for you may eat of them. You shall not cut them down, for is the tree of the field man, that it should be besieged by you?
speaker: Narrator

text: Only the trees that you know are not trees for food, you shall destroy and cut them down. You shall build bulwarks against the city that makes war with you, until it falls.
speaker: Narrator

text: If someone is found slain in the land which Yahweh your God gives you to possess, lying in the field, and it isn’t known who has struck him,
speaker: Narrator

text: then your elders and your judges shall come out, and they shall measure to the cities which are around him who is slain.
speaker: Narrator

text: It shall be that the elders of the city which is nearest to the slain man shall take a heifer of the herd, which hasn’t been worked with and which has not drawn in the yoke.
speaker: Narrator

text: The elders of that city shall bring the heifer down to a valley with running water, which is neither plowed nor sown, and shall break the heifer’s neck there in the valley.
speaker: Narrator

text: The priests the sons of Levi shall come near, for them Yahweh your God has chosen to minister to him, and to bless in Yahweh’s name; and according to their word shall every controversy and every assault be decided.
speaker: Narrator

text: All the elders of that city which is nearest to the slain man shall wash their hands over the heifer whose neck was broken in the valley.
speaker: Narrator

text: They shall answer and say, “Our hands have not shed this blood, neither have our eyes seen it.
speaker: Narrator

text: Forgive, Yahweh, your people Israel, whom you have redeemed, and don’t allow innocent blood among your people Israel.” The blood shall be forgiven them.
speaker: Narrator

text: So you shall put away the innocent blood from among you, when you shall do that which is right in Yahweh’s eyes.
speaker: Narrator

text: When you go out to battle against your enemies, and Yahweh your God delivers them into your hands and you carry them away captive,
speaker: Narrator

text: and see among the captives a beautiful woman, and you are attracted to her, and desire to take her as your wife,
speaker: Narrator

text: then you shall bring her home to your house. She shall shave her head and trim her nails.
speaker: Narrator

text: She shall take off the clothing of her captivity, and shall remain in your house, and bewail her father and her mother a full month. After that you shall go in to her and be her husband, and she shall be your wife.
speaker: Narrator

text: It shall be, if you have no delight in her, then you shall let her go where she desires; but you shall not sell her at all for money. You shall not deal with her as a slave, because you have humbled her.
speaker: Narrator

text: If a man has two wives, the one beloved and the other hated, and they have borne him children, both the beloved and the hated, and if the firstborn son is hers who was hated,
speaker: Narrator

text: then it shall be, in the day that he causes his sons to inherit that which he has, that he may not give the son of the beloved the rights of the firstborn before the son of the hated, who is the firstborn;
speaker: Narrator

text: but he shall acknowledge the firstborn, the son of the hated, by giving him a double portion of all that he has; for he is the beginning of his strength. The right of the firstborn is his.
speaker: Narrator

text: If a man has a stubborn and rebellious son who will not obey the voice of his father or the voice of his mother, and though they chasten him, will not listen to them,
speaker: Narrator

text: then his father and his mother shall take hold of him and bring him out to the elders of his city and to the gate of his place.
speaker: Narrator

text: They shall tell the elders of his city, “This our son is stubborn and rebellious. He will not obey our voice. He is a glutton and a drunkard.”
speaker: Narrator

text: All the men of his city shall stone him to death with stones. So you shall remove the evil from among you. All Israel shall hear, and fear.
speaker: Narrator

text: If a man has committed a sin worthy of death, and he is put to death, and you hang him on a tree,
speaker: Narrator

text: his body shall not remain all night on the tree, but you shall surely bury him the same day; for he who is hanged is accursed of God. Don’t defile your land which Yahweh your God gives you for an inheritance.
speaker: Narrator

text: You shall not see your brother’s ox or his sheep go astray and hide yourself from them. You shall surely bring them again to your brother.
speaker: Narrator

text: If your brother isn’t near to you, or if you don’t know him, then you shall bring it home to your house, and it shall be with you until your brother comes looking for it, and you shall restore it to him.
speaker: Narrator

text: So you shall do with his donkey. So you shall do with his garment. So you shall do with every lost thing of your brother’s, which he has lost and you have found. You may not hide yourself.
speaker: Narrator

text: You shall not see your brother’s donkey or his ox fallen down by the way, and hide yourself from them. You shall surely help him to lift them up again.
speaker: Narrator

text: A woman shall not wear men’s clothing, neither shall a man put on women’s clothing; for whoever does these things is an abomination to Yahweh your God.
speaker: Narrator

text: If you come across a bird’s nest on the way, in any tree or on the ground, with young ones or eggs, and the hen sitting on the young, or on the eggs, you shall not take the hen with the young.
speaker: Narrator

text: You shall surely let the hen go, but the young you may take for yourself, that it may be well with you, and that you may prolong your days.
speaker: Narrator

text: When you build a new house, then you shall make a railing around your roof, so that you don’t bring blood on your house if anyone falls from there.
speaker: Narrator

text: You shall not sow your vineyard with two kinds of seed, lest all the fruit be defiled, the seed which you have sown, and the increase of the vineyard.
speaker: Narrator

text: You shall not plow with an ox and a donkey together.
speaker: Narrator

text: You shall not wear clothes of wool and linen woven together.
speaker: Narrator

text: You shall make yourselves fringes on the four corners of your cloak with which you cover yourself.
speaker: Narrator

text: If any man takes a wife, and goes in to her, hates her,
speaker: Narrator

text: accuses her of shameful things, gives her a bad name, and says, “I took this woman, and when I came near to her, I didn’t find in her the tokens of virginity;”
speaker: Narrator

text: then the young lady’s father and mother shall take and bring the tokens of the young lady’s virginity to the elders of the city in the gate.
speaker: Narrator

text: The young lady’s father shall tell the elders, “I gave my daughter to this man as his wife, and he hates her.
speaker: Narrator

text: Behold, he has accused her of shameful things, saying, ‘I didn’t find in your daughter the tokens of virginity;’ and yet these are the tokens of my daughter’s virginity.” They shall spread the cloth before the elders of the city.
speaker: Narrator

text: The elders of that city shall take the man and chastise him.
speaker: Narrator

text: They shall fine him one hundred shekels of silver, and give them to the father of the young lady, because he has given a bad name to a virgin of Israel. She shall be his wife. He may not put her away all his days.
speaker: Narrator

text: But if this thing is true, that the tokens of virginity were not found in the young lady,
speaker: Narrator

text: then they shall bring out the young lady to the door of her father’s house, and the men of her city shall stone her to death with stones, because she has done folly in Israel, to play the prostitute in her father’s house. So you shall remove the evil from among you.
speaker: Narrator

text: If a man is found lying with a woman married to a husband, then they shall both die, the man who lay with the woman and the woman. So you shall remove the evil from Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: If there is a young lady who is a virgin pledged to be married to a husband, and a man finds her in the city, and lies with her,
speaker: Narrator

text: then you shall bring them both out to the gate of that city, and you shall stone them to death with stones; the lady, because she didn’t cry, being in the city; and the man, because he has humbled his neighbor’s wife. So you shall remove the evil from among you.
speaker: Narrator

text: But if the man finds the lady who is pledged to be married in the field, and the man forces her and lies with her, then only the man who lay with her shall die;
speaker: Narrator

text: but to the lady you shall do nothing. There is in the lady no sin worthy of death; for as when a man rises against his neighbor and kills him, even so is this matter;
speaker: Narrator

text: for he found her in the field, the pledged to be married lady cried, and there was no one to save her.
speaker: Narrator

text: If a man finds a lady who is a virgin, who is not pledged to be married, grabs her and lies with her, and they are found,
speaker: Narrator

text: then the man who lay with her shall give to the lady’s father fifty shekels of silver. She shall be his wife, because he has humbled her. He may not put her away all his days.
speaker: Narrator

text: A man shall not take his father’s wife, and shall not uncover his father’s skirt.
speaker: Narrator

text: He who is emasculated by crushing or cutting shall not enter into Yahweh’s assembly.
speaker: Narrator

text: A person born of a forbidden union shall not enter into Yahweh’s assembly; even to the tenth generation shall no one of his enter into Yahweh’s assembly.
speaker: Narrator

text: An Ammonite or a Moabite shall not enter into Yahweh’s assembly; even to the tenth generation shall no one belonging to them enter into Yahweh’s assembly forever,
speaker: Narrator

text: because they didn’t meet you with bread and with water on the way when you came out of Egypt, and because they hired against you Balaam the son of Beor from Pethor of Mesopotamia, to curse you.
speaker: Narrator

text: Nevertheless Yahweh your God wouldn’t listen to Balaam, but Yahweh your God turned the curse into a blessing to you, because Yahweh your God loved you.
speaker: Narrator

text: You shall not seek their peace nor their prosperity all your days forever.
speaker: Narrator

text: You shall not abhor an Edomite, for he is your brother. You shall not abhor an Egyptian, because you lived as a foreigner in his land.
speaker: Narrator

text: The children of the third generation who are born to them may enter into Yahweh’s assembly.
speaker: Narrator

text: When you go out and camp against your enemies, then you shall keep yourselves from every evil thing.
speaker: Narrator

text: If there is among you any man who is not clean by reason of that which happens to him by night, then shall he go outside of the camp. He shall not come within the camp;
speaker: Narrator

text: but it shall be, when evening comes, he shall bathe himself in water. When the sun is down, he shall come within the camp.
speaker: Narrator

text: You shall have a place also outside of the camp where you go relieve yourself.
speaker: Narrator

text: You shall have a trowel among your weapons. It shall be, when you relieve yourself, you shall dig with it, and shall turn back and cover your excrement;
speaker: Narrator

text: for Yahweh your God walks in the middle of your camp, to deliver you, and to give up your enemies before you. Therefore your camp shall be holy, that he may not see an unclean thing in you, and turn away from you.
speaker: Narrator

text: You shall not deliver to his master a servant who has escaped from his master to you.
speaker: Narrator

text: He shall dwell with you, among you, in the place which he shall choose within one of your gates, where it pleases him best. You shall not oppress him.
speaker: Narrator

text: There shall be no prostitute of the daughters of Israel, neither shall there be a sodomite of the sons of Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: You shall not bring the hire of a prostitute, or the wages of a male prostitute, into the house of Yahweh your God for any vow; for both of these are an abomination to Yahweh your God.
speaker: Narrator

text: You shall not lend on interest to your brother: interest of money, interest of food, interest of anything that is lent on interest.
speaker: Narrator

text: You may charge a foreigner interest; but you shall not charge your brother interest, that Yahweh your God may bless you in all that you put your hand to, in the land where you go in to possess it.
speaker: Narrator

text: When you vow a vow to Yahweh your God, you shall not be slack to pay it, for Yahweh your God will surely require it of you; and it would be sin in you.
speaker: Narrator

text: But if you refrain from making a vow, it shall be no sin in you.
speaker: Narrator

text: You shall observe and do that which has gone out of your lips. Whatever you have vowed to Yahweh your God as a free will offering, which you have promised with your mouth, you must do.
speaker: Narrator

text: When you come into your neighbor’s vineyard, then you may eat your fill of grapes at your own pleasure; but you shall not put any in your container.
speaker: Narrator

text: When you come into your neighbor’s standing grain, then you may pluck the ears with your hand; but you shall not use a sickle on your neighbor’s standing grain.
speaker: Narrator

text: When a man takes a wife and marries her, then it shall be, if she finds no favor in his eyes because he has found some unseemly thing in her, that he shall write her a certificate of divorce, put it in her hand, and send her out of his house.
speaker: Narrator

text: When she has departed out of his house, she may go and be another man’s wife.
speaker: Narrator

text: If the latter husband hates her, and writes her a certificate of divorce, puts it in her hand, and sends her out of his house; or if the latter husband dies, who took her to be his wife;
speaker: Narrator

text: her former husband, who sent her away, may not take her again to be his wife after she is defiled; for that would be an abomination to Yahweh. You shall not cause the land to sin, which Yahweh your God gives you for an inheritance.
speaker: Narrator

text: When a man takes a new wife, he shall not go out in the army, neither shall he be assigned any business. He shall be free at home one year, and shall cheer his wife whom he has taken.
speaker: Narrator

text: No man shall take the mill or the upper millstone as a pledge, for he takes a life in pledge.
speaker: Narrator

text: If a man is found stealing any of his brothers of the children of Israel, and he deals with him as a slave, or sells him, then that thief shall die. So you shall remove the evil from among you.
speaker: Narrator

text: Be careful in the plague of leprosy, that you observe diligently and do according to all that the Levitical priests teach you. As I commanded them, so you shall observe to do.
speaker: Narrator

text: Remember what Yahweh your God did to Miriam, by the way as you came out of Egypt.
speaker: Narrator

text: When you lend your neighbor any kind of loan, you shall not go into his house to get his pledge.
speaker: Narrator

text: You shall stand outside, and the man to whom you lend shall bring the pledge outside to you.
speaker: Narrator

text: If he is a poor man, you shall not sleep with his pledge.
speaker: Narrator

text: You shall surely restore to him the pledge when the sun goes down, that he may sleep in his garment and bless you. It shall be righteousness to you before Yahweh your God.
speaker: Narrator

text: You shall not oppress a hired servant who is poor and needy, whether he is one of your brothers or one of the foreigners who are in your land within your gates.
speaker: Narrator

text: In his day you shall give him his wages, neither shall the sun go down on it, for he is poor and sets his heart on it, lest he cry against you to Yahweh, and it be sin to you.
speaker: Narrator

text: The fathers shall not be put to death for the children, neither shall the children be put to death for the fathers. Every man shall be put to death for his own sin.
speaker: Narrator

text: You shall not deprive the foreigner or the fatherless of justice, nor take a widow’s clothing in pledge;
speaker: Narrator

text: but you shall remember that you were a slave in Egypt, and Yahweh your God redeemed you there. Therefore I command you to do this thing.
speaker: Narrator

text: When you reap your harvest in your field, and have forgotten a sheaf in the field, you shall not go again to get it. It shall be for the foreigner, for the fatherless, and for the widow, that Yahweh your God may bless you in all the work of your hands.
speaker: Narrator

text: When you beat your olive tree, you shall not go over the boughs again. It shall be for the foreigner, for the fatherless, and for the widow.
speaker: Narrator

text: When you harvest your vineyard, you shall not glean it after yourselves. It shall be for the foreigner, for the fatherless, and for the widow.
speaker: Narrator

text: You shall remember that you were a slave in the land of Egypt. Therefore I command you to do this thing.
speaker: Narrator

text: If there is a controversy between men, and they come to judgment and the judges judge them, then they shall justify the righteous and condemn the wicked.
speaker: Narrator

text: It shall be, if the wicked man is worthy to be beaten, that the judge shall cause him to lie down and to be beaten before his face, according to his wickedness, by number.
speaker: Narrator

text: He may sentence him to no more than forty stripes. He shall not give more, lest if he should give more and beat him more than that many stripes, then your brother will be degraded in your sight.
speaker: Narrator

text: You shall not muzzle the ox when he treads out the grain.
speaker: Narrator

text: If brothers dwell together, and one of them dies and has no son, the wife of the dead shall not be married outside to a stranger. Her husband’s brother shall go in to her, and take her as his wife, and perform the duty of a husband’s brother to her.
speaker: Narrator

text: It shall be that the firstborn whom she bears shall succeed in the name of his brother who is dead, that his name not be blotted out of Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: If the man doesn’t want to take his brother’s wife, then his brother’s wife shall go up to the gate to the elders, and say, “My husband’s brother refuses to raise up to his brother a name in Israel. He will not perform the duty of a husband’s brother to me.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the elders of his city shall call him, and speak to him. If he stands and says, “I don’t want to take her,”
speaker: Narrator

text: then his brother’s wife shall come to him in the presence of the elders, and loose his sandal from off his foot, and spit in his face. She shall answer and say, “So shall it be done to the man who does not build up his brother’s house.”
speaker: Narrator

text: His name shall be called in Israel, “The house of him who had his sandal removed.”
speaker: Narrator

text: When men strive against each other, and the wife of one draws near to deliver her husband out of the hand of him who strikes him, and puts out her hand, and grabs him by his private parts,
speaker: Narrator

text: then you shall cut off her hand. Your eye shall have no pity.
speaker: Narrator

text: You shall not have in your bag diverse weights, one heavy and one light.
speaker: Narrator

text: You shall not have in your house diverse measures, one large and one small.
speaker: Narrator

text: You shall have a perfect and just weight. You shall have a perfect and just measure, that your days may be long in the land which Yahweh your God gives you.
speaker: Narrator

text: For all who do such things, all who do unrighteously, are an abomination to Yahweh your God.
speaker: Narrator

text: Remember what Amalek did to you by the way as you came out of Egypt,
speaker: Narrator

text: how he met you by the way, and struck the rearmost of you, all who were feeble behind you, when you were faint and weary; and he didn’t fear God.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore it shall be, when Yahweh your God has given you rest from all your enemies all around, in the land which Yahweh your God gives you for an inheritance to possess it, that you shall blot out the memory of Amalek from under the sky. You shall not forget.
speaker: Narrator

text: It shall be, when you have come in to the land which Yahweh your God gives you for an inheritance, possess it, and dwell in it,
speaker: Narrator

text: that you shall take some of the first of all the fruit of the ground, which you shall bring in from your land that Yahweh your God gives you. You shall put it in a basket, and shall go to the place which Yahweh your God shall choose to cause his name to dwell there.
speaker: Narrator

text: You shall come to the priest who shall be in those days, and tell him, “I profess today to Yahweh your God, that I have come to the land which Yahweh swore to our fathers to give us.”
speaker: Narrator

text: The priest shall take the basket out of your hand, and set it down before Yahweh your God’s altar.
speaker: Narrator

text: You shall answer and say before Yahweh your God, “My father was a Syrian ready to perish. He went down into Egypt, and lived there, few in number. There he became a great, mighty, and populous nation.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Egyptians mistreated us, afflicted us, and imposed hard labor on us.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then we cried to Yahweh, the God of our fathers. Yahweh heard our voice, and saw our affliction, our toil, and our oppression.
speaker: Narrator

text: Yahweh brought us out of Egypt with a mighty hand, with an outstretched arm, with great terror, with signs, and with wonders;
speaker: Narrator

text: and he has brought us into this place, and has given us this land, a land flowing with milk and honey.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now, behold, I have brought the first of the fruit of the ground, which you, Yahweh, have given me.” You shall set it down before Yahweh your God, and worship before Yahweh your God.
speaker: Narrator

text: You shall rejoice in all the good which Yahweh your God has given to you, and to your house, you, and the Levite, and the foreigner who is among you.
speaker: Narrator

text: When you have finished tithing all the tithe of your increase in the third year, which is the year of tithing, then you shall give it to the Levite, to the foreigner, to the fatherless, and to the widow, that they may eat within your gates and be filled.
speaker: Narrator

text: You shall say before Yahweh your God, “I have put away the holy things out of my house, and also have given them to the Levite, to the foreigner, to the fatherless, and to the widow, according to all your commandment which you have commanded me. I have not transgressed any of your commandments, neither have I forgotten them.
speaker: Narrator

text: I have not eaten of it in my mourning, neither have I removed any of it while I was unclean, nor given of it for the dead. I have listened to Yahweh my God’s voice. I have done according to all that you have commanded me.
speaker: Narrator

text: Look down from your holy habitation, from heaven, and bless your people Israel, and the ground which you have given us, as you swore to our fathers, a land flowing with milk and honey.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Today Yahweh your God commands you to do these statutes and ordinances. You shall therefore keep and do them with all your heart and with all your soul.
speaker: Narrator

text: You have declared today that Yahweh is your God, and that you would walk in his ways, keep his statutes, his commandments, and his ordinances, and listen to his voice.
speaker: Narrator

text: Yahweh has declared today that you are a people for his own possession, as he has promised you, and that you should keep all his commandments.
speaker: Narrator

text: He will make you high above all nations that he has made, in praise, in name, and in honor, and that you may be a holy people to Yahweh your God, as he has spoken.
speaker: Narrator

text: Moses and the elders of Israel commanded the people, saying, “Keep all the commandment which I command you today.
speaker: Narrator

text: It shall be on the day when you shall pass over the Jordan to the land which Yahweh your God gives you, that you shall set yourself up great stones, and coat them with plaster.
speaker: Narrator

text: You shall write on them all the words of this law, when you have passed over, that you may go in to the land which Yahweh your God gives you, a land flowing with milk and honey, as Yahweh, the God of your fathers, has promised you.
speaker: Narrator

text: It shall be, when you have crossed over the Jordan, that you shall set up these stones, which I command you today, on Mount Ebal, and you shall coat them with plaster.
speaker: Narrator

text: There you shall build an altar to Yahweh your God, an altar of stones. You shall not use any iron tool on them.
speaker: Narrator

text: You shall build Yahweh your God’s altar of uncut stones. You shall offer burnt offerings on it to Yahweh your God.
speaker: Narrator

text: You shall sacrifice peace offerings, and shall eat there. You shall rejoice before Yahweh your God.
speaker: Narrator

text: You shall write on the stones all the words of this law very plainly.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Moses and the Levitical priests spoke to all Israel, saying, “Be silent and listen, Israel! Today you have become the people of Yahweh your God.
speaker: Narrator

text: You shall therefore obey Yahweh your God’s voice, and do his commandments and his statutes, which I command you today.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Moses commanded the people the same day, saying,
speaker: Narrator

text: “These shall stand on Mount Gerizim to bless the people, when you have crossed over the Jordan: Simeon, Levi, Judah, Issachar, Joseph, and Benjamin.
speaker: Narrator

text: These shall stand on Mount Ebal for the curse: Reuben, Gad, Asher, Zebulun, Dan, and Naphtali.
speaker: Narrator

text: With a loud voice, the Levites shall say to all the men of Israel,
speaker: Narrator

text:
‘Cursed is the man who makes an engraved or molten image, an abomination to Yahweh, the work of the hands of the craftsman, and sets it up in secret.’
All the people shall answer and say, ‘Amen.’
speaker: Narrator

text:
‘Cursed is he who dishonors his father or his mother.’
All the people shall say, ‘Amen.’
speaker: Narrator

text:
‘Cursed is he who removes his neighbor’s landmark.’
All the people shall say, ‘Amen.’
speaker: Narrator

text:
‘Cursed is he who leads the blind astray on the road.’
All the people shall say, ‘Amen.’
speaker: Narrator

text:
‘Cursed is he who withholds justice from the foreigner, fatherless, and widow.’
All the people shall say, ‘Amen.’
speaker: Narrator

text:
‘Cursed is he who lies with his father’s wife, because he dishonors his father’s bed.’
All the people shall say, ‘Amen.’
speaker: Narrator

text:
‘Cursed is he who lies with any kind of animal.’
All the people shall say, ‘Amen.’
speaker: Narrator

text:
‘Cursed is he who lies with his sister, his father’s daughter or his mother’s daughter.’
All the people shall say, ‘Amen.’
speaker: Narrator

text:
‘Cursed is he who lies with his mother-in-law.’
All the people shall say, ‘Amen.’
speaker: Narrator

text:
‘Cursed is he who secretly kills his neighbor.’
All the people shall say, ‘Amen.’
speaker: Narrator

text:
‘Cursed is he who takes a bribe to kill an innocent person.’
All the people shall say, ‘Amen.’
speaker: Narrator

text:
‘Cursed is he who doesn’t uphold the words of this law by doing them.’
All the people shall say, ‘Amen.’”
speaker: Narrator

text: It shall happen, if you shall listen diligently to Yahweh your God’s voice, to observe to do all his commandments which I command you today, that Yahweh your God will set you high above all the nations of the earth.
speaker: Narrator

text: All these blessings will come upon you, and overtake you, if you listen to Yahweh your God’s voice.
speaker: Narrator

text: You shall be blessed in the city, and you shall be blessed in the field.
speaker: Narrator

text: You shall be blessed in the fruit of your body, the fruit of your ground, the fruit of your animals, the increase of your livestock, and the young of your flock.
speaker: Narrator

text: Your basket and your kneading trough shall be blessed.
speaker: Narrator

text: You shall be blessed when you come in, and you shall be blessed when you go out.
speaker: Narrator

text: Yahweh will cause your enemies who rise up against you to be struck before you. They will come out against you one way, and will flee before you seven ways.
speaker: Narrator

text: Yahweh will command the blessing on you in your barns, and in all that you put your hand to. He will bless you in the land which Yahweh your God gives you.
speaker: Narrator

text: Yahweh will establish you for a holy people to himself, as he has sworn to you, if you shall keep the commandments of Yahweh your God, and walk in his ways.
speaker: Narrator

text: All the peoples of the earth shall see that you are called by Yahweh’s name, and they will be afraid of you.
speaker: Narrator

text: Yahweh will grant you abundant prosperity in the fruit of your body, in the fruit of your livestock, and in the fruit of your ground, in the land which Yahweh swore to your fathers to give you.
speaker: Narrator

text: Yahweh will open to you his good treasure in the sky, to give the rain of your land in its season, and to bless all the work of your hand. You will lend to many nations, and you will not borrow.
speaker: Narrator

text: Yahweh will make you the head, and not the tail. You will be above only, and you will not be beneath, if you listen to the commandments of Yahweh your God which I command you today, to observe and to do,
speaker: Narrator

text: and shall not turn away from any of the words which I command you today, to the right hand or to the left, to go after other gods to serve them.
speaker: Narrator

text: But it shall come to pass, if you will not listen to Yahweh your God’s voice, to observe to do all his commandments and his statutes which I command you today, that all these curses will come on you and overtake you.
speaker: Narrator

text: You will be cursed in the city, and you will be cursed in the field.
speaker: Narrator

text: Your basket and your kneading trough will be cursed.
speaker: Narrator

text: The fruit of your body, the fruit of your ground, the increase of your livestock, and the young of your flock will be cursed.
speaker: Narrator

text: You will be cursed when you come in, and you will be cursed when you go out.
speaker: Narrator

text: Yahweh will send on you cursing, confusion, and rebuke in all that you put your hand to do, until you are destroyed and until you perish quickly, because of the evil of your doings, by which you have forsaken me.
speaker: Narrator

text: Yahweh will make the pestilence cling to you, until he has consumed you from off the land where you go in to possess it.
speaker: Narrator

text: Yahweh will strike you with consumption, with fever, with inflammation, with fiery heat, with the sword, with blight, and with mildew. They will pursue you until you perish.
speaker: Narrator

text: Your sky that is over your head will be bronze, and the earth that is under you will be iron.
speaker: Narrator

text: Yahweh will make the rain of your land powder and dust. It will come down on you from the sky, until you are destroyed.
speaker: Narrator

text: Yahweh will cause you to be struck before your enemies. You will go out one way against them, and will flee seven ways before them. You will be tossed back and forth among all the kingdoms of the earth.
speaker: Narrator

text: Your dead bodies will be food to all birds of the sky, and to the animals of the earth; and there will be no one to frighten them away.
speaker: Narrator

text: Yahweh will strike you with the boils of Egypt, with the tumors, with the scurvy, and with the itch, of which you can not be healed.
speaker: Narrator

text: Yahweh will strike you with madness, with blindness, and with astonishment of heart.
speaker: Narrator

text: You will grope at noonday, as the blind gropes in darkness, and you shall not prosper in your ways. You will only be oppressed and robbed always, and there will be no one to save you.
speaker: Narrator

text: You will betroth a wife, and another man shall lie with her. You will build a house, and you won’t dwell in it. You will plant a vineyard, and not use its fruit.
speaker: Narrator

text: Your ox will be slain before your eyes, and you will not eat any of it. Your donkey will be violently taken away from before your face, and will not be restored to you. Your sheep will be given to your enemies, and you will have no one to save you.
speaker: Narrator

text: Your sons and your daughters will be given to another people. Your eyes will look and fail with longing for them all day long. There will be no power in your hand.
speaker: Narrator

text: A nation which you don’t know will eat the fruit of your ground and all of your work. You will only be oppressed and crushed always,
speaker: Narrator

text: so that the sights that you see with your eyes will drive you mad.
speaker: Narrator

text: Yahweh will strike you in the knees and in the legs with a sore boil, of which you cannot be healed, from the sole of your foot to the crown of your head.
speaker: Narrator

text: Yahweh will bring you, and your king whom you will set over yourselves, to a nation that you have not known, you nor your fathers. There you will serve other gods of wood and stone.
speaker: Narrator

text: You will become an astonishment, a proverb, and a byword among all the peoples where Yahweh will lead you away.
speaker: Narrator

text: You will carry much seed out into the field, and will gather little in, for the locust will consume it.
speaker: Narrator

text: You will plant vineyards and dress them, but you will neither drink of the wine, nor harvest, because worms will eat them.
speaker: Narrator

text: You will have olive trees throughout all your borders, but you won’t anoint yourself with the oil, for your olives will drop off.
speaker: Narrator

text: You will father sons and daughters, but they will not be yours, for they will go into captivity.
speaker: Narrator

text: Locusts will consume all of your trees and the fruit of your ground.
speaker: Narrator

text: The foreigner who is among you will mount up above you higher and higher, and you will come down lower and lower.
speaker: Narrator

text: He will lend to you, and you won’t lend to him. He will be the head, and you will be the tail.
speaker: Narrator

text: All these curses will come on you, and will pursue you and overtake you, until you are destroyed, because you didn’t listen to Yahweh your God’s voice, to keep his commandments and his statutes which he commanded you.
speaker: Narrator

text: They will be for a sign and for a wonder to you and to your offspring forever.
speaker: Narrator

text: Because you didn’t serve Yahweh your God with joyfulness and with gladness of heart, by reason of the abundance of all things;
speaker: Narrator

text: therefore you will serve your enemies whom Yahweh sends against you, in hunger, in thirst, in nakedness, and in lack of all things. He will put an iron yoke on your neck until he has destroyed you.
speaker: Narrator

text: Yahweh will bring a nation against you from far away, from the end of the earth, as the eagle flies: a nation whose language you will not understand,
speaker: Narrator

text: a nation of fierce facial expressions, that doesn’t respect the elderly, nor show favor to the young.
speaker: Narrator

text: They will eat the fruit of your livestock and the fruit of your ground, until you are destroyed. They also won’t leave you grain, new wine, oil, the increase of your livestock, or the young of your flock, until they have caused you to perish.
speaker: Narrator

text: They will besiege you in all your gates until your high and fortified walls in which you trusted come down throughout all your land. They will besiege you in all your gates throughout all your land which Yahweh your God has given you.
speaker: Narrator

text: You will eat the fruit of your own body, the flesh of your sons and of your daughters, whom Yahweh your God has given you, in the siege and in the distress with which your enemies will distress you.
speaker: Narrator

text: The man who is tender among you, and very delicate, his eye will be evil toward his brother, toward the wife whom he loves, and toward the remnant of his children whom he has remaining,
speaker: Narrator

text: so that he will not give to any of them of the flesh of his children whom he will eat, because he has nothing left to him, in the siege and in the distress with which your enemy will distress you in all your gates.
speaker: Narrator

text: The tender and delicate woman among you, who would not venture to set the sole of her foot on the ground for delicateness and tenderness, her eye will be evil toward the husband that she loves, toward her son, toward her daughter,
speaker: Narrator

text: toward her young one who comes out from between her feet, and toward her children whom she bears; for she will eat them secretly for lack of all things in the siege and in the distress with which your enemy will distress you in your gates.
speaker: Narrator

text: If you will not observe to do all the words of this law that are written in this book, that you may fear this glorious and fearful name, YAHWEH your God,
speaker: Narrator

text: then Yahweh will make your plagues and the plagues of your offspring fearful, even great plagues, and of long duration, and severe sicknesses, and of long duration.
speaker: Narrator

text: He will bring on you again all the diseases of Egypt, which you were afraid of; and they will cling to you.
speaker: Narrator

text: Also every sickness and every plague which is not written in the book of this law, Yahweh will bring them on you until you are destroyed.
speaker: Narrator

text: You will be left few in number, even though you were as the stars of the sky for multitude, because you didn’t listen to Yahweh your God’s voice.
speaker: Narrator

text: It will happen that as Yahweh rejoiced over you to do you good, and to multiply you, so Yahweh will rejoice over you to cause you to perish and to destroy you. You will be plucked from the land that you are going in to possess.
speaker: Narrator

text: Yahweh will scatter you among all peoples, from one end of the earth to the other end of the earth. There you will serve other gods which you have not known, you nor your fathers, even wood and stone.
speaker: Narrator

text: Among these nations you will find no ease, and there will be no rest for the sole of your foot; but Yahweh will give you there a trembling heart, failing of eyes, and pining of soul.
speaker: Narrator

text: Your life will hang in doubt before you. You will be afraid night and day, and will have no assurance of your life.
speaker: Narrator

text: In the morning you will say, “I wish it were evening!” and at evening you will say, “I wish it were morning!” for the fear of your heart which you will fear, and for the sights which your eyes will see.
speaker: Narrator

text: Yahweh will bring you into Egypt again with ships, by the way of which I told you that you would never see it again. There you will offer yourselves to your enemies for male and female slaves, and nobody will buy you.
speaker: Narrator

text: These are the words of the covenant which Yahweh commanded Moses to make with the children of Israel in the land of Moab, in addition to the covenant which he made with them in Horeb.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Moses called to all Israel, and said to them:
Your eyes have seen all that Yahweh did in the land of Egypt to Pharaoh, and to all his servants, and to all his land;
speaker: Narrator

text: the great trials which your eyes saw, the signs, and those great wonders.
speaker: Narrator

text: But Yahweh has not given you a heart to know, eyes to see, and ears to hear, to this day.
speaker: Narrator

text: I have led you forty years in the wilderness. Your clothes have not grown old on you, and your sandals have not grown old on your feet.
speaker: Narrator

text: You have not eaten bread, neither have you drunk wine or strong drink, that you may know that I am Yahweh your God.
speaker: Narrator

text: When you came to this place, Sihon the king of Heshbon and Og the king of Bashan came out against us to battle, and we struck them.
speaker: Narrator

text: We took their land, and gave it for an inheritance to the Reubenites, and to the Gadites, and to the half-tribe of the Manassites.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore keep the words of this covenant and do them, that you may prosper in all that you do.
speaker: Narrator

text: All of you stand today in the presence of Yahweh your God: your heads, your tribes, your elders, and your officers, even all the men of Israel,
speaker: Narrator

text: your little ones, your wives, and the foreigners who are in the middle of your camps, from the one who cuts your wood to the one who draws your water,
speaker: Narrator

text: that you may enter into the covenant of Yahweh your God, and into his oath, which Yahweh your God makes with you today,
speaker: Narrator

text: that he may establish you today as his people, and that he may be your God, as he spoke to you and as he swore to your fathers, to Abraham, to Isaac, and to Jacob.
speaker: Narrator

text: Neither do I make this covenant and this oath with you only,
speaker: Narrator

text: but with those who stand here with us today before Yahweh our God, and also with those who are not here with us today
speaker: Narrator

text: (for you know how we lived in the land of Egypt, and how we came through the middle of the nations through which you passed;
speaker: Narrator

text: and you have seen their abominations and their idols of wood, stone, silver, and gold, which were among them);
speaker: Narrator

text: lest there should be among you man, woman, family, or tribe whose heart turns away today from Yahweh our God, to go to serve the gods of those nations; lest there should be among you a root that produces bitter poison;
speaker: Narrator

text: and it happen, when he hears the words of this curse, that he bless himself in his heart, saying, “I shall have peace, though I walk in the stubbornness of my heart,” to destroy the moist with the dry.
speaker: Narrator

text: Yahweh will not pardon him, but then Yahweh’s anger and his jealousy will smoke against that man, and all the curse that is written in this book will fall on him, and Yahweh will blot out his name from under the sky.
speaker: Narrator

text: Yahweh will set him apart for evil out of all the tribes of Israel, according to all the curses of the covenant written in this book of the law.
speaker: Narrator

text: The generation to come—your children who will rise up after you, and the foreigner who will come from a far land—will say, when they see the plagues of that land, and the sicknesses with which Yahweh has made it sick,
speaker: Narrator

text: that all of its land is sulfur, salt, and burning, that it is not sown, doesn’t produce, nor does any grass grow in it, like the overthrow of Sodom, Gomorrah, Admah, and Zeboiim, which Yahweh overthrew in his anger, and in his wrath.
speaker: Narrator

text: Even all the nations will say, “Why has Yahweh done this to this land? What does the heat of this great anger mean?”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then men will say, “Because they abandoned the covenant of Yahweh, the God of their fathers, which he made with them when he brought them out of the land of Egypt,
speaker: Narrator

text: and went and served other gods and worshiped them, gods that they didn’t know and that he had not given to them.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore Yahweh’s anger burned against this land, to bring on it all the curses that are written in this book.
speaker: Narrator

text: Yahweh rooted them out of their land in anger, in wrath, and in great indignation, and thrust them into another land, as it is today.”
speaker: Narrator

text: The secret things belong to Yahweh our God; but the things that are revealed belong to us and to our children forever, that we may do all the words of this law.
speaker: Narrator

text: It shall happen, when all these things have come on you, the blessing and the curse, which I have set before you, and you shall call them to mind among all the nations where Yahweh your God has driven you,
speaker: Narrator

text: and return to Yahweh your God and obey his voice according to all that I command you today, you and your children, with all your heart and with all your soul,
speaker: Narrator

text: that then Yahweh your God will release you from captivity, have compassion on you, and will return and gather you from all the peoples where Yahweh your God has scattered you.
speaker: Narrator

text: If your outcasts are in the uttermost parts of the heavens, from there Yahweh your God will gather you, and from there he will bring you back.
speaker: Narrator

text: Yahweh your God will bring you into the land which your fathers possessed, and you will possess it. He will do you good, and increase your numbers more than your fathers.
speaker: Narrator

text: Yahweh your God will circumcise your heart, and the heart of your offspring, to love Yahweh your God with all your heart and with all your soul, that you may live.
speaker: Narrator

text: Yahweh your God will put all these curses on your enemies and on those who hate you, who persecuted you.
speaker: Narrator

text: You shall return and obey Yahweh’s voice, and do all his commandments which I command you today.
speaker: Narrator

text: Yahweh your God will make you prosperous in all the work of your hand, in the fruit of your body, in the fruit of your livestock, and in the fruit of your ground, for good; for Yahweh will again rejoice over you for good, as he rejoiced over your fathers,
speaker: Narrator

text: if you will obey Yahweh your God’s voice, to keep his commandments and his statutes which are written in this book of the law, if you turn to Yahweh your God with all your heart and with all your soul.
speaker: Narrator

text: For this commandment which I command you today is not too hard for you or too distant.
speaker: Narrator

text: It is not in heaven, that you should say, “Who will go up for us to heaven, bring it to us, and proclaim it to us, that we may do it?”
speaker: Narrator

text: Neither is it beyond the sea, that you should say, “Who will go over the sea for us, bring it to us, and proclaim it to us, that we may do it?”
speaker: Narrator

text: But the word is very near to you, in your mouth and in your heart, that you may do it.
speaker: Narrator

text: Behold, I have set before you today life and prosperity, and death and evil.
speaker: Narrator

text: For I command you today to love Yahweh your God, to walk in his ways and to keep his commandments, his statutes, and his ordinances, that you may live and multiply, and that Yahweh your God may bless you in the land where you go in to possess it.
speaker: Narrator

text: But if your heart turns away, and you will not hear, but are drawn away and worship other gods, and serve them,
speaker: Narrator

text: I declare to you today that you will surely perish. You will not prolong your days in the land where you pass over the Jordan to go in to possess it.
speaker: Narrator

text: I call heaven and earth to witness against you today that I have set before you life and death, the blessing and the curse. Therefore choose life, that you may live, you and your descendants,
speaker: Narrator

text: to love Yahweh your God, to obey his voice, and to cling to him; for he is your life, and the length of your days, that you may dwell in the land which Yahweh swore to your fathers, to Abraham, to Isaac, and to Jacob, to give them.
speaker: Narrator

text: Moses went and spoke these words to all Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: He said to them, “I am one hundred twenty years old today. I can no more go out and come in. Yahweh has said to me, ‘You shall not go over this Jordan.’
speaker: Narrator

text: Yahweh your God himself will go over before you. He will destroy these nations from before you, and you shall dispossess them. Joshua will go over before you, as Yahweh has spoken.
speaker: Narrator

text: Yahweh will do to them as he did to Sihon and to Og, the kings of the Amorites, and to their land, when he destroyed them.
speaker: Narrator

text: Yahweh will deliver them up before you, and you shall do to them according to all the commandment which I have commanded you.
speaker: Narrator

text: Be strong and courageous. Don’t be afraid or scared of them, for Yahweh your God himself is who goes with you. He will not fail you nor forsake you.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Moses called to Joshua, and said to him in the sight of all Israel, “Be strong and courageous, for you shall go with this people into the land which Yahweh has sworn to their fathers to give them; and you shall cause them to inherit it.
speaker: Narrator

text: Yahweh himself is who goes before you. He will be with you. He will not fail you nor forsake you. Don’t be afraid. Don’t be discouraged.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Moses wrote this law and delivered it to the priests the sons of Levi, who bore the ark of Yahweh’s covenant, and to all the elders of Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: Moses commanded them, saying, “At the end of every seven years, in the set time of the year of release, in the feast of booths,
speaker: Narrator

text: when all Israel has come to appear before Yahweh your God in the place which he will choose, you shall read this law before all Israel in their hearing.
speaker: Narrator

text: Assemble the people, the men and the women and the little ones, and the foreigners who are within your gates, that they may hear, learn, fear Yahweh your God, and observe to do all the words of this law,
speaker: Narrator

text: and that their children, who have not known, may hear and learn to fear Yahweh your God, as long as you live in the land where you go over the Jordan to possess it.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
Yahweh said to Moses, “Behold, your days approach that you must die. Call Joshua, and present yourselves in the Tent of Meeting, that I may commission him.”
Moses and Joshua went, and presented themselves in the Tent of Meeting.
speaker: Narrator

text: Yahweh appeared in the Tent in a pillar of cloud, and the pillar of cloud stood over the Tent’s door.
speaker: Narrator

text: Yahweh said to Moses, “Behold, you shall sleep with your fathers. This people will rise up and play the prostitute after the strange gods of the land where they go to be among them, and will forsake me and break my covenant which I have made with them.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then my anger shall be kindled against them in that day, and I will forsake them, and I will hide my face from them, and they shall be devoured, and many evils and troubles shall come on them; so that they will say in that day, ‘Haven’t these evils come on us because our God is not among us?’
speaker: Narrator

text: I will surely hide my face in that day for all the evil which they have done, in that they have turned to other gods.
speaker: Narrator

text: “Now therefore write this song for yourselves, and teach it to the children of Israel. Put it in their mouths, that this song may be a witness for me against the children of Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: For when I have brought them into the land which I swore to their fathers, flowing with milk and honey, and they have eaten and filled themselves, and grown fat, then they will turn to other gods, and serve them, and despise me, and break my covenant.
speaker: Narrator

text: It will happen, when many evils and troubles have come on them, that this song will testify before them as a witness; for it will not be forgotten out of the mouths of their descendants; for I know their ways and what they are doing today, before I have brought them into the land which I promised them.”
speaker: Narrator

text: So Moses wrote this song the same day, and taught it to the children of Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: He commissioned Joshua the son of Nun, and said, “Be strong and courageous; for you shall bring the children of Israel into the land which I swore to them. I will be with you.”
speaker: Narrator

text: When Moses had finished writing the words of this law in a book, until they were finished,
speaker: Narrator

text: Moses commanded the Levites, who bore the ark of Yahweh’s covenant, saying,
speaker: Narrator

text: “Take this book of the law, and put it by the side of the ark of Yahweh your God’s covenant, that it may be there for a witness against you.
speaker: Narrator

text: For I know your rebellion and your stiff neck. Behold, while I am yet alive with you today, you have been rebellious against Yahweh. How much more after my death?
speaker: Narrator

text: Assemble to me all the elders of your tribes and your officers, that I may speak these words in their ears, and call heaven and earth to witness against them.
speaker: Narrator

text: For I know that after my death you will utterly corrupt yourselves, and turn away from the way which I have commanded you; and evil will happen to you in the latter days, because you will do that which is evil in Yahweh’s sight, to provoke him to anger through the work of your hands.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Moses spoke in the ears of all the assembly of Israel the words of this song, until they were finished.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Give ear, you heavens, and I will speak.
    Let the earth hear the words of my mouth.
speaker: Narrator

text:
My doctrine will drop as the rain.
    My speech will condense as the dew,
    as the misty rain on the tender grass,
    as the showers on the herb.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For I will proclaim Yahweh’s name.
    Ascribe greatness to our God!
speaker: Narrator

text:
The Rock: his work is perfect,
    for all his ways are just.
    A God of faithfulness who does no wrong,
    just and right is he.
speaker: Narrator

text:
They have dealt corruptly with him.
    They are not his children, because of their defect.
    They are a perverse and crooked generation.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Is this the way you repay Yahweh,
    foolish and unwise people?
Isn’t he your father who has bought you?
    He has made you and established you.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Remember the days of old.
    Consider the years of many generations.
Ask your father, and he will show you;
    your elders, and they will tell you.
speaker: Narrator

text:
When the Most High gave to the nations their inheritance,
    when he separated the children of men,
he set the bounds of the peoples
    according to the number of the children of Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For Yahweh’s portion is his people.
    Jacob is the lot of his inheritance.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He found him in a desert land,
    in the waste howling wilderness.
He surrounded him.
    He cared for him.
    He kept him as the apple of his eye.
speaker: Narrator

text:
As an eagle that stirs up her nest,
    that flutters over her young,
he spread abroad his wings,
    he took them,
    he bore them on his feathers.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Yahweh alone led him.
    There was no foreign god with him.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He made him ride on the high places of the earth.
    He ate the increase of the field.
He caused him to suck honey out of the rock,
    oil out of the flinty rock;
speaker: Narrator

text:
butter from the herd, and milk from the flock,
    with fat of lambs,
    rams of the breed of Bashan, and goats,
    with the finest of the wheat.
    From the blood of the grape, you drank wine.
speaker: Narrator

text:
But Jeshurun grew fat, and kicked.
    You have grown fat.
    You have grown thick.
    You have become sleek.
Then he abandoned God who made him,
    and rejected the Rock of his salvation.
speaker: Narrator

text:
They moved him to jealousy with strange gods.
    They provoked him to anger with abominations.
speaker: Narrator

text:
They sacrificed to demons, not God,
    to gods that they didn’t know,
    to new gods that came up recently,
    which your fathers didn’t dread.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Of the Rock who became your father, you are unmindful,
    and have forgotten God who gave you birth.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Yahweh saw and abhorred,
    because of the provocation of his sons and his daughters.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
They have moved me to jealousy with that which is not God.
    They have provoked me to anger with their vanities.
I will move them to jealousy with those who are not a people.
    I will provoke them to anger with a foolish nation.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For a fire is kindled in my anger,
    that burns to the lowest Sheol,
    devours the earth with its increase,
    and sets the foundations of the mountains on fire.
speaker: Narrator

text:
“I will heap evils on them.
    I will spend my arrows on them.
speaker: Narrator

text:
They shall be wasted with hunger,
    and devoured with burning heat
    and bitter destruction.
I will send the teeth of animals on them,
    with the venom of vipers that glide in the dust.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Outside the sword will bereave,
    and in the rooms,
    terror on both young man and virgin,
    the nursing infant with the gray-haired man.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I said that I would scatter them afar.
    I would make their memory to cease from among men;
speaker: Narrator

text:
were it not that I feared the provocation of the enemy,
    lest their adversaries should judge wrongly,
    lest they should say, ‘Our hand is exalted;
    Yahweh has not done all this.’”
speaker: Narrator

text:
For they are a nation void of counsel.
    There is no understanding in them.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Oh that they were wise, that they understood this,
    that they would consider their latter end!
speaker: Narrator

text:
How could one chase a thousand,
    and two put ten thousand to flight,
unless their Rock had sold them,
    and Yahweh had delivered them up?
speaker: Narrator

text:
For their rock is not as our Rock,
    even our enemies themselves concede.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For their vine is of the vine of Sodom,
    of the fields of Gomorrah.
Their grapes are poison grapes.
    Their clusters are bitter.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Their wine is the poison of serpents,
    the cruel venom of asps.
speaker: Narrator

text:
“Isn’t this laid up in store with me,
    sealed up among my treasures?
speaker: Narrator

text:
Vengeance is mine, and recompense,
    at the time when their foot slides,
for the day of their calamity is at hand.
    Their doom rushes at them.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
For Yahweh will judge his people,
    and have compassion on his servants,
when he sees that their power is gone,
    that there is no one remaining, shut up or left at large.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He will say, “Where are their gods,
    the rock in which they took refuge,
speaker: Narrator

text:
which ate the fat of their sacrifices,
    and drank the wine of their drink offering?
Let them rise up and help you!
    Let them be your protection.
speaker: Narrator

text:
“See now that I myself am he.
    There is no god with me.
I kill and I make alive.
    I wound and I heal.
    There is no one who can deliver out of my hand.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For I lift up my hand to heaven and declare,
    as I live forever,
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
I will make my arrows drunk with blood.
    My sword shall devour flesh with the blood of the slain and the captives,
    from the head of the leaders of the enemy.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
Rejoice, you nations, with his people,
    for he will avenge the blood of his servants.
    He will take vengeance on his adversaries,
    and will make atonement for his land and for his people.
speaker: Narrator

text: Moses came and spoke all the words of this song in the ears of the people, he and Joshua the son of Nun.
speaker: Narrator

text: Moses finished reciting all these words to all Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: He said to them, “Set your heart to all the words which I testify to you today, which you shall command your children to observe to do, all the words of this law.
speaker: Narrator

text: For it is no vain thing for you, because it is your life, and through this thing you shall prolong your days in the land, where you go over the Jordan to possess it.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Yahweh spoke to Moses that same day, saying,
speaker: Narrator

text: “Go up into this mountain of Abarim, to Mount Nebo, which is in the land of Moab, that is across from Jericho; and see the land of Canaan, which I give to the children of Israel for a possession.
speaker: Narrator

text: Die on the mountain where you go up, and be gathered to your people, as Aaron your brother died on Mount Hor, and was gathered to his people;
speaker: Narrator

text: because you trespassed against me among the children of Israel at the waters of Meribah of Kadesh, in the wilderness of Zin; because you didn’t uphold my holiness among the children of Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: For you shall see the land from a distance; but you shall not go there into the land which I give the children of Israel.”
speaker: Narrator

text: This is the blessing with which Moses the man of God blessed the children of Israel before his death.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He said,
“Yahweh came from Sinai,
    and rose from Seir to them.
He shone from Mount Paran.
    He came from the ten thousands of holy ones.
    At his right hand was a fiery law for them.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Yes, he loves the people.
    All his saints are in your hand.
    They sat down at your feet.
    Each receives your words.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Moses commanded us a law,
    an inheritance for the assembly of Jacob.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He was king in Jeshurun,
    when the heads of the people were gathered,
    all the tribes of Israel together.
speaker: Narrator

text:
“Let Reuben live, and not die;
    Nor let his men be few.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
This is for Judah. He said,
“Hear, Yahweh, the voice of Judah.
    Bring him in to his people.
With his hands he contended for himself.
    You shall be a help against his adversaries.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
About Levi he said,
“Your Thummim and your Urim are with your godly one,
    whom you proved at Massah,
    with whom you contended at the waters of Meribah.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
They shall teach Jacob your ordinances,
    and Israel your law.
They shall put incense before you,
    and whole burnt offering on your altar.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Yahweh, bless his skills.
    Accept the work of his hands.
Strike through the hips of those who rise up against him,
    of those who hate him, that they not rise again.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
About Benjamin he said,
“The beloved of Yahweh will dwell in safety by him.
    He covers him all day long.
    He dwells between his shoulders.”
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
for the precious things of the fruits of the sun,
    for the precious things that the moon can yield,
speaker: Narrator

text:
for the best things of the ancient mountains,
    for the precious things of the everlasting hills,
speaker: Narrator

text:
for the precious things of the earth and its fullness,
    the good will of him who lived in the bush.
Let this come on the head of Joseph,
    on the crown of the head of him who was separated from his brothers.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Majesty belongs to the firstborn of his herd.
    His horns are the horns of the wild ox.
    With them he will push all the peoples to the ends of the earth.
They are the ten thousands of Ephraim.
    They are the thousands of Manasseh.”
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
They will call the peoples to the mountain.
    There they will offer sacrifices of righteousness,
for they will draw out the abundance of the seas,
    the hidden treasures of the sand.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
About Gad he said,
“He who enlarges Gad is blessed.
    He dwells as a lioness,
    and tears the arm and the crown of the head.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He provided the first part for himself,
    for the lawgiver’s portion was reserved for him.
He came with the heads of the people.
    He executed the righteousness of Yahweh,
    His ordinances with Israel.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
About Dan he said,
“Dan is a lion’s cub
    that leaps out of Bashan.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
About Naphtali he said,
“Naphtali, satisfied with favor,
    full of Yahweh’s blessing,
    Possess the west and the south.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
About Asher he said,
“Asher is blessed with children.
    Let him be acceptable to his brothers.
    Let him dip his foot in oil.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Your bars will be iron and bronze.
    As your days, so your strength will be.
speaker: Narrator

text:
“There is no one like God, Jeshurun,
    who rides on the heavens for your help,
    in his excellency on the skies.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The eternal God is your dwelling place.
    Underneath are the everlasting arms.
He thrust out the enemy from before you,
    and said, ‘Destroy!’
speaker: Narrator

text:
Israel dwells in safety,
    the fountain of Jacob alone,
In a land of grain and new wine.
    Yes, his heavens drop down dew.
speaker: Narrator

text:
You are happy, Israel!
    Who is like you, a people saved by Yahweh,
    the shield of your help,
    the sword of your excellency?
Your enemies will submit themselves to you.
    You will tread on their high places.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Moses went up from the plains of Moab to Mount Nebo, to the top of Pisgah, that is opposite Jericho. Yahweh showed him all the land of Gilead to Dan,
speaker: Narrator

text: and all Naphtali, and the land of Ephraim and Manasseh, and all the land of Judah, to the Western Sea,
speaker: Narrator

text: and the south, and the Plain of the valley of Jericho the city of palm trees, to Zoar.
speaker: Narrator

text: Yahweh said to him, “This is the land which I swore to Abraham, to Isaac, and to Jacob, saying, ‘I will give it to your offspring.’ I have caused you to see it with your eyes, but you shall not go over there.”
speaker: Narrator

text: So Moses the servant of Yahweh died there in the land of Moab, according to Yahweh’s word.
speaker: Narrator

text: He buried him in the valley in the land of Moab opposite Beth Peor, but no man knows where his tomb is to this day.
speaker: Narrator

text: Moses was one hundred twenty years old when he died. His eye was not dim, nor his strength gone.
speaker: Narrator

text: The children of Israel wept for Moses in the plains of Moab thirty days, until the days of weeping in the mourning for Moses were ended.
speaker: Narrator

text: Joshua the son of Nun was full of the spirit of wisdom, for Moses had laid his hands on him. The children of Israel listened to him, and did as Yahweh commanded Moses.
speaker: Narrator

text: Since then, there has not arisen a prophet in Israel like Moses, whom Yahweh knew face to face,
speaker: Narrator

text: in all the signs and the wonders which Yahweh sent him to do in the land of Egypt, to Pharaoh, and to all his servants, and to all his land,
speaker: Narrator

text: and in all the mighty hand, and in all the awesome deeds, which Moses did in the sight of all Israel.
speaker: Narrator
